They are dressed in black tie and evening clothes. Flashbulbs go off, the lig dim, and a spotlight shines on a dark, thin man with glas He says in Italian (subtitled in English):

dialogues.speaker: FESTIVAL DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, we are very pleased to welcome you to the world premiere of Part 1 of the newest film from a great favorite of ours here at Loquasto, Mr. Steve Zissou. A brief Q & A will immediately follow the screening. Thank you very much. The man leaves the stage as the spotlight goes off. The a applauds. The words Loquasto International Film Festival projected against a gold silk curtain. The gold curtain o red curtain beneath it rises, and the film begins. dialogues.speaker: TITLE
dialogues.text: with Steve Zissou  The image un-freezes, and the birds fly away.

dialogues.text: A small Mediterranean island. There is a marina in the foreground and a collection of houses and laboratory buildings in the background.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE
dialogues.text: Adventure No. 12: “The Jaguar Shark” (Part 1)

dialogues.speaker: INT. OFFICE. DAY
dialogues.text: Zissou stands next to a window in an office overlooking t compound and the ocean beyond it. He wears a brown suit w pinstripes and a thin black tie. He speaks calmly into th camera:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: The Oubyamywe Peninsula. A remote and fascinating region teeming with extraordinary marine life. Zissou pulls down a chain and lowers a map from an appara mounted on the wall. He points with a pencil to a spot on Western coast of Africa.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: We chose its mysterious waters as the Belafonte’s next destination. Zissou sits at his desk with charts and graphs in front o him and a model of his ship, the Belafonte, at his side.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: In preparation for our voyage, the members of Team Zissou gathered at my oceanographic observatory here on Pescespada Island. The camera slowly zooms in on Zissou.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: This was to be our most ambitious adventure to date -- and, ultimately, a tragic one.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MAIN DECK. DAY
dialogues.text: The crew of the Belafonte sets to work on-board the ship. They wear pale blue swimsuits with navy stripes down the sides, long-sleeved aquamarine polyester shirts with epa and Team Zissou logos on them, and red knitted caps. Each a Glock pistol in a holster on his belt. Zissou introduce them in voice-over.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Our team included: cuT TO: A heavy-set, slightly hunched man with a shaved head and bull’s neck but soft eyes. He directs the lowering of a m sub suspended from a crane.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Esteban du Plantier, 66, Chief Diver. Our senior statesman, my closest colleague for twenty-seven years.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A tall, rakish man holding a pair of sunglasses in his mo He checks the air pressure gauges on an oxygen tank.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Klaus Daimler, 40, Engineer. Calm, collected, German.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.0.)

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A young Japanese-American man in a wet suit treading wate beside the ship. A dolphin surfaces next to him. He strok it.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Bobby Ogata, 22, Frogman. Can hold his breath for seven minutes, thirty-eight seconds.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO

dialogues.text: A very skinny man with goggles on top of his head sitting behind a microscope. He holds up a slide and squints at i

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Anne-Marie Sakowitz, 25, Script-girl.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Pelé dos Santos, 30, Safety Expert.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A beautiful woman in her late forties standing at the pro the ship smoking a brown cigarette. Her hair is wet, long and black, parted on the side with a clip in it. She wear white bathrobe.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Eleanor Zissou, my wife/Vice-President of the Zissou Society.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARINA, DAY
dialogues.text: Seven slightly-built college students dressed in Team Zis T-shirts and camp shorts walk up the gangplank carrying extremely heavy equipment.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We had also invited seven marine science students from the University of North Alaska to accompany us as unpaid interns in exchange for school credit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is anchored at sea in open waters. A narrator announces:

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: October 12. Entry in the logbook of the Belafonte by Captain Zissou.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MAIN DECK. DAY
dialogues.text: Zissou and Esteban pose in their diving gear looking into camera with their arms around each other’s shoulders. Zis kisses Esteban on the cheek. Esteban breaks a saltine in and gives Zissou half.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Esteban and I explore the blue reefs beyond the peninsula.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou and Esteban swimming underwater through a bright b atoll. A school of gently glowing pink fish moves past th ZzISSOU (V.0.) Fluorescent snapper unexpectedly appear in the shallows -- extremely rare at this depth. Zissou captures one of the fish with a cloth net. It glow pink beneath the thin fabric. Zissou and Esteban laugh through their mouthpieces, and bubbles cascade all around them.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MAIN DECK. DAY
dialogues.text: Klaus and Ogata look nervously over the side of the ship. water beneath them bubbles violently and begins to turn r Klaus yells to Ogata:

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Where's your gun? Ogata hesitates. Zissou surfaces suddenly. There is blood his wet suit. He rips off his mask and gasps. He looks disoriented and wildly agitated. He points into the camer and shouts with his voice raspy and cracking:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Is that rolling? Vikram!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve? What’s happening? Where’s --

dialogues.speaker: Z1SSOU
dialogues.text: Tail slate! Second sticks! Take one! Encounter with highly abnormal shark-like fish at least ten meters in length with unfamiliar dorsal features and spots all over it! I shot it dorsally with a homing dart! Esteban was eaten! Check the scanning monitor and start tracking it before it dives too --

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: (stunned) Esteban was bitten?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (pause) Eaten!

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: (shocked) Is he dead?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (emphatically) Esteban was eaten! Check the scanning monitor before it goes too deep!

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: (confused) Was he -- he was swallowed whole?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (hesitates) No! Chewed! Check the scanning monitor! Ogata is filming with a second camera. He puts it down an starts to run inside. Klaus notices that Zissou’s eyes ar pinned and blood-shot, and there is a green film around h lips. He says to himself:

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: He’s got hydrogen psychosis. Crazy-eye! (yelling to Ogata) Wait! Get him out of the fucking water! There’s something down there! Klaus and Ogata scramble down a ladder to help Zissou. Kl says loudly but calmly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve, we think you’ve got crazy-eye! Don’t try to -- Zissou suddenly loses control of himself, jerking around screaming hysterically toward the water:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Esteban! Esteban! Esteban! Esteban!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou sitting in the audience viewing the film. He wears red pin in the lapel of his tuxedo. A gold legion of hono medal hangs around his neck. There is a diamond star earr in his left earlobe. His face looks hollow, and his eyes dark and sunken. He watches expressionlessly. Eleanor sits beside him looking down at the floor. She ha her hair in a French twist and wears a sleek, silver dres and pearls.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou and the director of the festival sitting at a tabl stage after the screening. The audience has thinned out significantly. The director of the festival points to a m in the orchestra. The man asks a question in Italian. The director of the festival translates for Zissou:

dialogues.speaker: FESTIVAL DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Was it a deliberate choice never to show the jaguar shark?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: No, I dropped the camera. The audience laughs. The director of the festival transla Zissou's answer into Italian, and the audience laughs aga

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Why are they laughing? The audience laughs. An exceptionally clean-cut man in his late twenties sits the front row of the highest tier of the balconies. He ha short blond hair, parted neatly on the side. He wears an airline pilot’s uniform with a Colonel Sanders-type strin tie and has his cap tucked under his arm. He is Ned Plimp Ned raises his hand, and the director of the festival po to him. Ned speaks with the accent of a deep Southerner:

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: What’s next for Team Zissou? Zissou shields his eyes from the lights with his hand and squints at Ned. He says evenly:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Well, that was only Part 1. It’s a cliff- hanger. Now I’m going to hunt down that shark or whatever it is, and, hopefully, kill it. I’m not sure how, maybe dynamite. A murmur goes through the audience. Some of them have alr begun to gather their things and make their way to the ex The director of the festival looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: FESTIVAL DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: You don’t know what it is?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: No. I’ve never seen anything like it in my life.

dialogues.speaker: FESTIVAL DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: You said it was a jaguar shark. That’s the title of the film.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: He was coming right at us. I said the first two words that came into my head. The director of the festival hesitates. Zissou points to young woman in the audience with her hand in the air. She asks a question in French. The director of the festival translates for Zissou:

dialogues.speaker: FESTIVAL DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: It's an endangered species, at most. What would be the scientific purpose of killing it? Silence. Zissou answers as if it goes without saying:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Revenge. The director of the festival translates Zissou’s answer i French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobby of the theatre. A terrace opens onto the harbor and the Belafonte is anchored in the distance. The member the audience flood out of the auditorium. Zissou walks wi the director of the festival at his side. An elderly man dressed in a safari jacket follows, stalking them. A pale angular woman wearing bright red lipstick and a complex, asymmetrical hat intercepts them.

dialogues.speaker: PALE WOMAN
dialogues.text: Bravo! What fun!

dialogues.speaker: FESTIVAL DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Steve, I'd like to introduce you to Antonia Cook, the new head of the film society. The woman clasps Zissou'’s hands.

dialogues.speaker: PALE WOMAN
dialogues.text: You must be so excited! ZISsoU (distracted) I hope so. You thought it went OK?

dialogues.speaker: PALE WOMAN
dialogues.text: No, congratulations. Seriously.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Thanks. I wish it didn’t need the seriously, but --

dialogues.speaker: PALE WOMAN
dialogues.text: Hm? (suddenly pensive) Well, I just don’t think they knew what to make of it.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Yeah. Oh, well. Fuck it, I guess. Zissou pushes through the crowded room. He comes upon a seventy-year-old Englishman with white hair, oiled and co straight back, and large, round sunglasses. He wears a bl suit, a white shirt, and a white tie. He is Oseary Drakoulias. Drakoulias takes hold of Zissou’s arm and say enthusiastically:

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: Steve --  10.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (to himself) It’s a shit turnout tonight.

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: (hesitates) I believe you know Larry Amin, Chairman of Saudifilm. Drakoulias motions to a small Arab man standing next to h The man has a neat, white beard and a military-style bere with a jewel pinned into it. Zissou nods restlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Z2I1SSOU
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: Larry and I were just discussing our financial predicament. Shall the three of us ride out to the party together?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Why? Has Larry got that kind of spending bread to invest? A pair of photographers interrupts:

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Captain Zissou, can we get a shot of you and Captain Hennessey? Zissou frowns. He turns and sees an immaculately dressed in black tie and chromium-framed eyeglasses with the same medal around his neck and pin in his lapel that Zissou we He also has several additional ribbons and badges, and he holds a gold-plated award statuette of a barracuda. He is surrounded by a Japanese television crew. He is Alistair Hennessey. Zissou says to the photographers:

dialogues.speaker: Z1SSOU
dialogues.text: Make it quick. Zissou and Hennessey stand shoulder-to-shoulder for the photographers. The elderly man in the safari jacket stand among them, watching. Flashbulbs start popping.

dialogues.speaker: HENNESSEY
dialogues.text: Hello, Steven. How are things going with your -- what are you calling it? Leopard fish?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Jaguar shark.  1i.

dialogues.speaker: HENNESSEY
dialogues.text: (thrilled) Jaguar shark, exactly! I love it! (gravely) Tell me something. Does it actually exist? Pause. Zissou smiles slightly.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Well, you know, Allie. I don’t want to give away the ending. Hennessey nods and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HENNESSEY
dialogues.text: Good man. Here comes our girl. Hennessey motions to Eleanor approaching from across the room. He kisses her on both cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: HENNESSEY
dialogues.text: You're the most ravishing creature I’ve seen in my life.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Hello, Skinny. Eleanor points to one of Hennessey’s medals.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Is that a new merit badge?

dialogues.speaker: HENNESSEY
dialogues.text: (pleased) As a matter of fact, it is. I just became a knight in Portugal. The presidente --

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Don’t be nice to Allie. He’s my nemesis. Hennessey laughs. He kisses Eleanor again and rejoins his Japanese television crew. Eleanor takes Zissou by the arm walks with him.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: How could you lay that slick faggot?

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Well, I was in love with him, at the time.  12.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: {sighs) Yeah, I know. He’s charismatic.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (strangely) I'm right on the edge. I don’t know what comes next. Eleanor looks into Zissou’s eyes. She frowns. She opens h handbag and digs inside. She says to Zissou:

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Wait here. I’11 be right back. Eleanor walks away. A tall, beautiful African girl comes and stops squarely in front of Zissou. Zissou looks nervo

dialogues.speaker: AFRICAN GIRL
dialogues.text: I just wanted to say hello. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (relieved) Hey, baby. Zissou starts to kiss the African girl on the cheek. She blocks him with her arm and feints away. Zissou looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: AFRICAN GIRL
dialogues.text: I said I wanted to say hello. I didn’t say I wanted you to touch me. Silence. Eleanor returns with a glass of whiskey and two Valiums for Zissou. She and the African girl stare at eac other. Zissou points to Bleanor.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I'm here with my wife. Eleanor, this is Mandeeza. Mandeeza --

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Do we really want to put me through this? Pause. Zissou shakes his head. Eleanor hands him the whis and the pills. She and the African girl walk swiftly away different directions. Zissou sees the elderly man in the safari jacket spying on him from behind a lamp. The elder Man moves away. Zissou swallows the pills and drinks the whiskey. He goes over to a television set on a pedestal.  13. It shows him being interviewed on an English talk show. Esteban sits beside him. The host says:

dialogues.speaker: HOST, (ON T.V.)
dialogues.text: People say Eleanor is the brains behind Team Zissou. What is Steve? Zissou hesitates. Esteban interrupts slyly:

dialogues.speaker: ESTEBAN, (ON T.V.)
dialogues.text: He’s the Zissou. Esteban shrugs. Zissou smiles identically on television and watching it. reaches out and touches Esteban’s face on the screen. Sta crackles at his fingertip. He turns away from the televis set and looks across the room blankly. Klaus brings over ten-year-old German boy with bronze~colored skin and near white hair in a buzz-cut. He wears lederhosen. He carries small plastic bag filled with water.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Steve, this is my little nephew, Werner. He wanted to meet you. Zissou pats the boy on the head.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: How you doing, Werner? Werner holds out the plastic bag.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: He brought you a present. Zissou takes the plastic bag and holds it up to his eyes. There is a tiny blue, green, yellow, red, and orange stri sea-horse swimming inside. Zissou says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: A crayon pony-fish. Zissou looks down at Werner. ZISsou Thanks, pal. Zissou takes off his tie and puts it into his pocket. He on his collar and takes a deep breath. Klaus frowns.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: You don’t look too good, Steve.  14. Zissou licks his hand and presses down his hair awkwardly rearranging his cowlicks. He looks to Klaus.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: How about now? Klaus hesitates. Zissou sees the elderly man in the safar jacket lurking behind him. He snaps:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: What do you need, old man? The elderly man thrusts a photograph and a pen into Zisso hands.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: Could you sign this, please? Zissou looks at the photograph. It is a picture of a youn blond Zissou underwater pointing a spear-gun at a black s with four blue eyes and yellow ink. A title across the bo says Shadow Creatures of the Lurisia Archipelago. Zissou signs the photograph.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: And this. The elderly man hands Zissou another photograph. It is a picture of two divers with movie cameras filming a swarm writhing sea-cobras. A title across the bottom says The Battling Eels of Antibes. Zissou signs the photograph.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: And this. The elderly man hands Zissou another photograph. It is a picture of a younger Zissou running at a full sprint alongside a black panther with white spots. A title acros the bottom says Island Cats! Zissou frowns.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: How many you got there? Zissou sees that there are about twenty-five more photogr in the elderly man’s hand. He frowns.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Just forge the rest of them, will you?  15.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: (hesitates) But I could’ve done that --

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Get lost. Get out of here. The elderly man looks startled. He walks away. Zissou sees Eleanor standing alone outside the window loo into the harbor. He raps on the glass. Eleanor turns to l at him. Zissou shrugs. He waves to her. Eleanor waves bac sadly. She holds up a pill of her own and swallows it wit drink of whiskey. Zissou smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. AUDITORIUM. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Zissou and Eleanor come out of the theatre and walk down red carpet along the front steps surrounded by a mob of f and paparazzi snapping pictures, jostling, and yelling. Drakoulias, Klaus, Ogata, Pelé, Renzo, and Vikram follow them. Zissou is blank and silent. He puts on his red cap. A tall man in a polo shirt motions to Zissou.

dialogues.speaker: TALL MAN
dialogues.text: Hey, Steve! How come you’re not sitting shiva for your friend Esteban? Zissou stops. He looks at the man.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: What’d you say? Pause. The man shrugs and says with a slight smile:

dialogues.speaker: TALL MAN
dialogues.text: Who you going to kill in Part 2? The man points a pocket camera at Zissou and takes a snapshot. Zissou stares at the man. He lunges through the crowd and reaches for the man’s throat. The man dodges awkwardly and clips Zissou across the mouth with his came Klaus and Drakoulias pull Zissou back. The mob goes into panic. Eleanor lights a cigarette. Zissou moves away, disoriented, holding his hand against mouth. A line of blood runs down the side of his chin. He looks at his sea-horse. The plastic bag is leaking.  16. Zissou takes a glass of champagne out of someone’s hand. empties it onto the ground. He pours the sea-horse and th rest of the water into the glass. He walks down the steps a daze, holding the glass carefully above the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MAIN DECK. NIGHT
dialogues.text: A party on-board the Belafonte moored in the bay. Pelé si on deck playing a David Bowie song on a guitar. The guest are writers, artists, scientists, socialites, movie stars fashion models, government officials, and business tycoon Three motorboats flying Team Zissou flags wait tied along the ship. The lights of hotels and casinos glimmer on the shore.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SALON. NIGHT
dialogues.text: A living room with faux-wood Formica walls and tables for backgammon, chess, and cards. Drakoulias sits in a red vi armchair. Eleanor is on a red vinyl sofa playing solitair There are strips of duct tape to repair rips in the vinyl Zissou has a swollen cut on his lip. He paces around the room. Klaus and Wolodarsky play backgammon in the corner. Drakoulias holds a glass of sherry. The party continues outside.

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: Larry Amin’s flying back to Mecca tonight to see if he can make the numbers work. He‘1l have an answer for us in ten days.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (immediately) Tell him we need to know by Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Why would I do that, my darling?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (shrugs) To call his bluff, dammit. To light a fire under his ass.

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULTIAS
dialogues.text: My darling, we haven’t made a hit documentary in nine years. Let’s not fuck with Larry Amin. Explain it to him, Eleanor.  17.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: (flipping a card) He understands. Amin has to make a projection of the world grosses to see if he can get a tax break and run it through his output deal.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I don’t understand -- but I can tell it’s bullshit. Eleanor looks to Zissou. Zissou stares down at her cards.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: You can put the three on the four. Pause. Eleanor moves the three of clubs onto the four of hearts.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Werner, what are you doing? Werner stands on a table in the corner of the room with h sleeve rolled up to his shoulder and his arm reaching for turtle at the bottom of an aquarium filled with water.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Be careful, Werner. That’s a snapper. Werner lifts the turtle out of the aquarium. It has red a yellow markings and a slightly broken shell. He flips it over. The word Albert is written on the bottom of the tur in magic marker. He drops it back into the tank. Silence. Zissou shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Well, if you’1l excuse me, I’m going to go on an overnight drunk, and in ten days I’m going to head out to find the shark that ate my friend and destroy it. Anyone who wants to join me is more than welcome. Zissou goes out the door.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MAIN DECK. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The party is in full swing. Zissou puts on his red cap an walks purposefully toward the bar. The pilot from the upp balcony at the screening approaches him and says reluctan  18.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Captain Zissou? I’m sorry to bother you. I’m Ned Plimpton. ZISsoU (distracted) OK, man.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: My mother was Katherine Plimpton. Zissou stops. He looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: You're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (hesitates) How is she?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: She died last month.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (pause) Oh. I‘m sorry. Holy shit. She was -- Hm. A long, complicated moment passes between Zissou and Ned. Zissou says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I've heard of you. Zissou and Ned step out of the crowd and stand together n to the railing of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I don’t know if it’s true, by the way. Do you?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: No, I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I hadn’t seen her in maybe thirty years. (pause) I guess it’s too late now. Ned nods. Silence.  19.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: She never contacted me, you know.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Yes, I see.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: You're supposed to be my son, right?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: I don’t know. But I did want to meet you, just in case.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I appreciate that. Zissou pats Ned gently on the shoulder. He takes a deep breath. He nods. Ned locks at him with a hopeful expressi Zissou suddenly finds himself struggling to hold back his emotions. He looks up at the sky. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Z2ISSOU
dialogues.text: I'll be right back. Don’t go away. Zissou turns and walks quickly among the party-goers. The try to get his attention, but he does not respond. He cli a set of stairs. He goes to the prow of the ship. He reac into his pocket, takes out a joint, and lights it. He stands alone, smoking, and looks out at the dark ocean

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou coming back to Ned, who has not moved an inch.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. You’re catching me with one foot off the merry-go-round tonight.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s all right. I don’t want to take up any more of your time. Thank you very much for talking to me. Drakoulias grabs Zissou and Ned by their arms. He is now slightly drunk.

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: We'll find a way, mate.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I know we will.  20. Drakoulias hugs Zissou.

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: I just had a lovely chat with Si Perlman, and he wants to make a big to-do of the Oceanographic Explorer article and possibly give you the cover, so do be nice to this girl Miss Winslett- Richardson. Apparently, she worships you, and we dearly need the press. Zissou nods and motions to Ned.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: This is probably my son, Ned. We just met.

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: (pause) Ah. Delightful.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. UPPER DECK. NIGHT
dialogues.text: A long table under an awning at the back of the ship. It filled with people, including Drakoulias, talking loudly drinking. Eleanor sits with her legs crossed holding a champagne cocktail and smoking a cigarette. Zissou stands above her with Ned just behind them.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Obviously, this all comes unexpectedly. You never knew about it. But --

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: I'd heard the story -- and you told me it wasn’t true.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Well, it probably isn’t. We’re talking ancient history here. But, anyway, his mother just died, plus we’re having some problems -- Eleanor gives Zissou a cold look. Ned jams his hands into pockets and shifts uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: -- and I just think it’s a very special opportunity for all of us. Especially him. He needs this deal.  21.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: (quickly) OK. Bring him over.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Well, he’s right here. Zissou points to Ned. Eleanor turns around and sees him. bows awkwardly. Eleanor looks flustered. She says simply:

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR,
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. How do you do?

dialogues.speaker: INT. BRIDGE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Zissou and Ned sit in the dark at the controls of the shi Lights blink on the consoles. Zissou smokes a joint.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: No, it went OK. There’s just a lot in play here that’s got nothing to do with you, in terms of me and Eleanor. Zissou hands the joint to Ned. Ned hesitates, then takes puff. He exhales. ZISsou So tell me. What do you do? Pause. Ned points to his pilot’s cap.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: I’m a pilot. For Air Kentucky. Co-pilot, actually.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Air Kentucky. Yeah. I don’t know that one.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (nods) We hub out of Louisville.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Oh, sure. There’s some pretty country around those parts. Land-locked. Can I get that number back over here for a second? Zissou points to the joint in Ned’s hand. Ned quickly han it back to Zissou.  22.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon. Zissou nods and smokes.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: I have to tell you, I’ve been a member of the Zissou Society since I was eleven. Ned shows Zissou a Team Zissou ring on his finger. It is old and looks like it came out of a cereal box. Zissou lo at it and says with admiration:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Well, I’11 be dammed. Look at that. Zissou offers the joint back to Ned.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: You want to kill this?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Frankly, I’d better not. I don’t usually try grass. Ned takes an old-fashioned pipe out of his jacket pocket. lights it with a match, takes a puff, and smiles at Zisso Zissou shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Are you putting me on? Is this what you’re really like?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (hesitates} In what sense? Pause. Zissou nods.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: OK. I buy it. Zissou picks up his model of the Belafonte and holds it i his hands.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Let me tell you about my boat.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A life-sized cross-section of the entire ship anchored in shallow waters. The hull is rusted along the water-line a needs a coat of paint. It is day, and the sky is pink. Zi  23. stands on deck with a fishing pole in his hands. People m among the cabins inside. There are schools of fish, coral and seaweed below. The camera takes us from one area to t next as Zissou describes the facilities in voice-over:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Belafonte was a long-range sub-hunter during the second world war, which we bought from the U.S. Navy for $900,000. This is my mentor, Lord Mandrake. He's dead now. A silver-nitrate photograph of a dashing old man hangs on wall of the dining room. In the picture, the man stands o beach dressed all in white with his trouser legs rolled-u The camera booms down two levels to a completely blue-til Spa on the lowest deck. Steam fills the air. A sturdy, No woman in her sixties gives Klaus a violent massage.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The sauna was designed by an engineer from the Chinese space program, and we keep a Swedish masseuse on staff. We move quickly past a laboratory with a large, colorful periodic table hanging from the wall. Wolodarsky sits on stool nocdling on a Casio keyboard and a cheap drum machi A beaker of orange liquid bubbles on a Bunsen burner. Zis says dismissively:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Here’s where we do all our different science projects and experiments and so on. We arrive at the kitchen. There is a fancy, new dishwashe computerized refrigerator, and a digital toaster-oven. Th wine cellar is twice the size of the laboratory. A cook i Happy Birthday, Ogata! across the top of a cake.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: This is the kitchen, which contains probably some of the most technologically advanced equipment on the ship. The next cabin is lined with books from floor to ceiling every wall, with a Dewey decimal system card-catalogue. T is a metal rack displaying a twenty-five volume collectio Zissou Society books on various, esoteric undersea creatu and phenomena: Tragedy of the Red Octopus, The Sexual Maturity of the Moonfish, The Arctic Night-lights. They a all written by Eleanor Zissou, and she sits behind the ra correcting a set of proofs and smoking a brown cigarette.  24. ZISsou (V.0.) Eleanor put together a top-notch research library for us, with a complete, first- edition set of the Life Aquatic companion series. We go to a sound-proofed room the size of a closet. Vikra sits inside behind a glass partition. He wears headphones Renzo operates a tape recorder. There is also a flat-bed editing console and an accumulation of out-dated film developing machines.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: We process our own rushes and keep a cutting room on-board so we can do an assembly while we're shooting. There are three little beeps before Vikram speaks into a microphone in a panicked voice:

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: I can’t find them! Renzo murmurs some mild approval and presses a button. We move to a metal sphere with portholes all over it connect to the bottom of the ship. Ogata is inside. He looks out his face pressed against the glass. ZISsou (V.0.) This is the observation bubble, which I thought up in a dream, actually. There are two white dolphins with cameras and electronic attached to them swimming underwater alongside the vessel They have pink eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Two albino scouts swim with the ship. They’re supposedly very intelligent, although I’ve never seen any evidence of it. We move past the screw and rudder back up into the ship. motor looks old and jerry-rigged, with a severely rusted warped section of rods and valves, which leak into a pan.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Here’s the engine room. The bearing- casings aren’t supposed to look like that, but we can‘t afford to fix them this year.  25. The main deck is outfitted with an array of weather-beate equipment, two cranes, and a helicopter landing deck. Pel sits in a chair tuning his guitar.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Topside, we’ve got the bridge, the mini- sub, an old chopper, and all kinds of radar and sonar and underwater movie gadgets. A submersible vessel on deck was once called Jacqueline, that word has been crossed-out, and Deep Search has been printed below it.

dialogues.speaker: NED, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What happened to Jacqueline?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (bittersweet) She didn’t really love me. All the lights in the ship dim suddenly, and the light of pink sky and the blue water gently fades to black.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. EXPLORERS CLUB. DAY
dialogues.text: The next morning. A converted palazzo behind a church. A brass plaque next to the door says Explorers Club.

dialogues.speaker: INT. EXPLORERS CLUB. DAY
dialogues.text: The great hall. There are paintings of adventurers on the walls: big-game hunters, arctic explorers, archaeologists astronauts, aviators, etc. Under a stuffed and mounted swordfish, there are portraits of three oceanographers. One is of Mandrake, based on the photograph. One is of Zissou, underwater in a swimsuit. One is of Hennessey, dressed in a tailored white lab coat, tweed pants, sandal and a pink cashmere scarf. He wears a supercilious half- smile. Zissou and Ned are still in their clothes from the night before. They look very dishevelled. Zissou points to the picture of Hennessey.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: This guy’s a big-time asshole. We were room-mates at the Academy, and he used to be married to Eleanor. (more)  26. ZISSOU (cont'd) (pause) He hogs up all the grant money. The dining room, which is empty except for a few leathery battle-hardened old men and a group of young academics. A waiter stands beside Zissou and Ned at their table. ZISsSoU You think you'll want to change your name?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Ned?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: No, not the Ned part, unless you want to. I mean your last name. I thought you might let me give you mine.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: {pause) Ned Zissou.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Ned Zissou, exactly. Or, if you want, you can change the first part, too. I would've named you Kingsley if I'd hada say in it.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Kingsley. I don’t know. Maybe I'll stick with Ned, for now.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Sure. That's OK. Anyway, I'll order you some correspondence stock. The waiter opens a bottle of red wine and pours a little into Ned’s glass for him to taste. Zissou looks horrified says to the waiter:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: What are you doing? The waiter hesitates. Ned looks uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: He doesn’t know anything about wine. I ordered the wine. Pour it here.  27. The waiter pours some wine for Zissou. Zissou leans forwa and sniffs it. He nods. The waiter fills their glasses.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: You know, I wasn’t sure you’d even want to meet me.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well, we still need to find out if we're really compatible as father and son, I guess. (annoyed) Are those assholes talking about me? One of the young academics at the next table says loudly Italian (subtitled in English):

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ACADEMIC
dialogues.text: No, I thought that was Steve Zissou. Have you seen him lately? He’s gotten creepy. He wears a gay little earring, and he drunkenly tried to hit on my fifteen-year- old cousin at a French disco. She was terrified. What happened to him? His last movies are just total -- One of the young academic’s companions whispers something him. The young academic frowns.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ACADEMIC
dialogues.text: What? No. The young academic turns around quickly and looks Zissou square in the eye. Zissou stares at him coldly. The young academic looks mortified. He turns away and sinks into hi chair. Silence. Zissou suddenly bursts out laughing hysterically

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET. DAY
dialogues.text: A narrow, cobble-stoned alley at the edge of a square. Zi sits on a curb in the shadows curled over with his head buried in his lap and his arms wrapped around his knees. squats beside him.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: People tell me when someone says something like that about you, it’s because they’re jealous -- but it still hurts. (with a catch in his voice) It hurts bad.  28.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: That man was damn rude. He can go to hell. Zissou stands up. He takes the earring out of his ear and throws it into the street. Ned picks it up and hands it b to Zissou. Zissou puts it into his pocket. (He will never wear it again.)

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: How’d she die, by the way? Your mother.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (pause) She took her own life. She took sleeping pills.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: {wounded) Why would she do that?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Well, she was in a great deal of pain, you know.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (quietly) Oh. I see. Yeah. (pause) You know, my best friend just got killed. Esteban.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: I know he did. I’m sorry. Zissou nods. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Let’s go to my island.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Well, but I’m supposed to be back in Kentucky on Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Thursday, OK. That’s OK. Zissou looks up and down the street. He turns to Ned.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Where can we charter a water-plane around here?  29.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OCEAN. DAY
dialogues.text: A small, single-engine sea-plane flies low over the water banks around a group of tiny, volcanic islands.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARINA. DAY
dialogues.text: Zissou and Ned climb out of the sea-plane onto the dock a Pescespada Island. Zissou carries an open bottle of black rum, and each holds a shot glass. They walk toward the compound.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ZISSOU HOUSE. DAY
dialogues.text: The main living quarters is a white and pale blue terra-c house with peeling paint and numerous French doors, all w open. White curtains ripple in the breeze, and dozens of domesticated birds fly in and out of the rooms. Five Siam cats prowl around the front porch. There are olive trees grape vines and two Irish wolfhounds in the garden. There a small wooden tower ten feet tall with a ladder up the s and a telescope on the top. Eleanor stands at the end of the path. She wears white pa and a white tunic with a string of turquoise beads around neck. She holds a white tulip bulb and a trowel. There ar grass stains and dirt on her clothes. She watches as Ziss and Ned shuffle over to her. Zissou drinks the last of the rum and hands Ned the empty bottle.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Your cat’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (stunned) What? Which one?

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Marmalade. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (pained) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: A rattlesnake bit it in the throat.

dialogues.speaker: 2ISSOU
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Goddammit, Eleanor. Why do you have to (more)  30. ZIssou (cont'd) say it like that? Couldn’t you break it to me a little -- Eleanor turns away and walks into the garden. Zissou and stand together in silence. Zissou finally sighs and says: ZISsOoU She’s a rich bitch, you know. She was raised by maids. Her parents paid for this island and two of my worst movies. (pause) People say she’s the brains behind Team Zissou.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: People say a lot of things. What kind of cat was it?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (upset) Who gives a shit? Pause. Zissou says sadly:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I think she was a tabby. Ned nods. Eleanor finishes planting her tulip and walks p Zissou and Ned, toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Come inside, Ned. Let’s make-up a room for you. Ned looks to Zissou and follows Eleanor into the house. Eleanor says without looking back:

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: That reporter called. Zissou nods. He goes over to a bucket of ice near the fro door and takes out a fish. He walks through the garden to large swimming pool adjacent to the laboratory buildings. stands on the edge of a platform and holds the fish out o the water. He waits expressionlessly. A killer whale bursts into the air, takes the fish out of Zissou’s hand, and splashes back into the water.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ZISSOU HOUSE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: A guest bedroom. Ned is asleep with the windows open. A digital flip-clock reads 2AM. Zissou’s voice shouts from intercom next to the bed:  Ned opens Ned finds 31.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ned, wake up! his eyes and looks around the room in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m on the echo-box! Push the red button to answer! Throw on your slop and meet me on the beach in twelve minutes! the intercom. He holds down a red button and says:

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BEACH. NIGHT
dialogues.text: There is a mist along the shore. Ned has a tape recorder slung around his neck. He wears headphones and holds a microphone. Klaus carries a 16mm camera with a spotlight attached to it on his shoulder. Zissou and Ogata stand in front of them. They have large flashlights, which are tur off. They all wear pale blue and green striped pajamas. Zissou speaks into Klaus’ camera:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Seven-apple, take one. (dramatically) Only twice before have I had the good fortune to observe a rubber tide -- that rare occurrence when hundreds of electric jellyfish spontaneously wash onto a beach- head at once. Ogata brings exactly this to our attention tonight. Zissou nods to Ogata. They turn on their flashlights. The is a sea of man-of-wars awash on the shore. They shimmer breathe in the soft glow. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Steve, what produces that effect of illumination? Is there a chemical inside the organism?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (pause) No, Ned. It’s actually the reflection of our flashlights off their outer membranes. (impressed with Ned’s line) That was a good ad-lib. Zissou stares at Ned. He turns to Klaus suddenly.  32.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Klaus, move into a two-shot of me and Ned. Zissou stands next to Ned. Klaus points the camera at the of them. Zissou puts his hand on Ned’s shoulder and says heightened significance:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Would you like to join my crew? Klaus looks horrified. Ned hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I want you on Team Zissou. Ned looks surprised and moved. Klaus cuts the camera. Ned says reluctantly:

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: I don’t think I can do that.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSCU
dialogues.text: (thrown) Why not?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Well, for one thing, it’s not my field. I don’t have the background for it.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Nobody here does. Klaus used to be a bus Griver. Wolodarsky was a high-school substitute teacher. I found Esteban slinging cassoulet in a cheap road-side brasserie. (standing on his toes) We’re all a pack of strays -- don’t you get it?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: I’m not even that strong of a swimmer, Steve. Zissou stares at Ned with a blank expression. Ned says suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: The answer is yes.  33.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Well, it’s got to be. I’1ll order you a red cap and a Speedo. Zissou hugs Ned. Ned seems overwhelmed. Zissou turns to Klaus.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Cut. Zissou sees that Klaus is pointing the camera at the grou

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Klaus! Why aren’t you rolling? You’re supposed to be getting this.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Can I have a word with you, please? Zissou frowns. He goes over to Klaus, and they speak privately.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: That was a goddamn tear-jerker. Why'd you eut it, man?

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Because the sound’s going to be shit. He doesn’t know how to hold a boom. He doesn’t know diddly-jack about what we do.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Don’t cut unless I say cut.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (excitedly) I’ve never seen so many electric jellyfish in my life! Zissou and Klaus look at Ned. A voice behind them says:

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Those are Viet-Cong man-of-wars. They all turn around and see a pregnant, thirty-year-old woman with three suitcases standing about twenty-five fee away in the mist near the water. She wears rolled-up khak shorts, a safari jacket, and rubber boots. Her hair is in braided pony-tail. She chews gum. She locks severely exhausted.  34. Zissou stares down at one of the man-o-wars. He nudges it with his foot.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Shit. She's right. I guess we'll have to loop that line. (to Jane) Where’d you come from? You look pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I am pregnant. I’m not even going to ask what you men are doing out here in your matching pajamas, by the way. ZISsou (annoyed) We're producing a film, as matter of fact. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I’m Jane Winslett-Richardson. I'm the reporter from Oceanographic Explorer.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Sure. How’d you get out here?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I hired some drunk with a fishing boat.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Well, that takes four hours. Why’d you --

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Because no one picked me up at the f-ing airport.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: You’re kidding. Jesus Christ, Klaus! I'm sorry. One of my guys was supposed to do that.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CORRIDOR. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ned and Klaus carry Jane’s suitcases down a long hallway. Zissou and Jane walk with them, empty-handed. There are action-photographs of crew members past and present on ev wall. Jane says to Ned:

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: How long have you been working with Zissou?  35.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Approximately only ten minutes, actually. I was hired during the scene on the beach.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: (skeptically) He‘s Steve’s son, supposedly.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (surprised) You are? No, you’re not. He doesn’t have one.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (warmly) Well, we’re not 100 percent sure about that. We just met yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou and Klaus standing outside of Jane's room while Ne lugs her bags through the door. They see Jane’s reflectio the bathroom mirror as she shakes some sand out of her sh She is cocked over with her shirt tugged up in the back. blows a bubble. Zissou looks to Klaus. Klaus raises an eyebrow. Zissou sh his head.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Not this one, Klaus.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: You heard me. Not this one, Klaus.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: (shrugs) OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is filled with racks of lenses, filters, tripods etc. Zissou puts a can of exposed film into a refrigerato Eleanor stands in the doorway dressed in her white bathro

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with him?  36.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Who? Ned? What do you mean? (hesitates) I don‘t understand the question. Eleanor shrugs. She turns away and starts to go.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I offered him a spot on the Belafonte. Eleanor stops and stands with her back to Zissou. She say darkly:

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: He didn’t take it, did he?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (urgently) Of course, he took it. We’re going to put him on the map, Eleanor. We’re going to throw him a life saver. I believe in this boy.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Why? Pause. Zissou shrugs. He says simply:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Because he looks up to me.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CORRIDOR. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ned stands at the end of the hallway talking on a wall- mounted telephone. He holds an Air Kentucky travel bag of toiletries.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. And McKinnon’s willing to take over my shuttle flights. That's right. Ned listens for a minute. He says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Well, I just feel I need to see this thing through, sir. (pause) Thank you for understanding. I’11 check in with the Louisville office again next month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned walking barefoot down the corridor. He goes past one the guest rooms. The door is half-open. He stops and list A Bach cassette plays on a tape recorder, and Jane says i loud, measured voice:

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Perhaps if her eyes had not been quite so black -- which was what struck one most forcibly on first seeing her -- I would not have been, as I was, so especially enamored of their imagined blue. Ned lcoks inside. Jane is sitting-up in her bunk. She wea an army issue bathrobe and has a copy of a book by Marcel Proust in her lap. Her bags are unpacked, and clothes, papers, and junk-food wrappers are strewn all over the ro She sees Ned. Ned freezes. He ducks out into the hall. Ja frowns. She says loudly:

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Hold it. Ned looks back into Jane’s room. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Is that a poem?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (hesitates) No, it’s a six-volume novel. Jane points to the other five volumes stacked on a chair to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Mercy. Are you going to read the whole thing to yourself out loud?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I’m not reading it to myself. I’m reading it to him. Jane points at her stomach. Ned nods.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: That's nice. I bet it’1ll make him smarter. Jane shrugs. Pause. She points at Ned.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: When did you learn Zissou was your father?  38. Ned looks uneasy. Jane raises an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Does it freak you out for me to ask that?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: No, but it’s a difficult question. I sort of pieced it together over the years.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Well, how did he first contact you?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: He didn’t. I came looking for him after my mother died last month. She had ovarian cancer, and then it spread to her stomach and liver, and then she took her own life.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (pause) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Well, good-night, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Good-night . Ned lcoks to the door. He looks back to Jane. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I stay and listen for a little while?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (long pause) OK. Ned quickly takes the stack of books off the chair and si down. Jane shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: You want me to catch you up on the story?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: No, I‘1l1 figure it out. Jane nods. She turns the page and continues.  39.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ZISSOU HOUSE. DAY
dialogues.text: The next morning. Zissou sits outside in a yellow folding lawn chair. Klaus and Jane stand beside him. The patio do is open, and Ned sweeps the kitchen floor in the backgrou He is dressed in his pilot’s uniform and a Team Zissou ap Zissou slices open a large cardboard box with a diving kn

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: They made them for three and a half years before they terminated my sponsorship. Zissou holds the knife in his teeth while he pulls away s bubble wrap and spills out a pile of Styrofoam packaging peanuts. The box is filled with white sneakers with aquamarine laces and aquamarine, navy, and swimming-pool- green stripes. The labels on the sneakers read: Adidas Zissou. Zissou takes out a pair and checks the size. He says quie

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I’d say this lot comes from around 1987. Zissou slips on a pair, stands up, and starts jumping up down, bouncing on the fresh treads. He says wildly enthusiastically:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Wow! These are great!

dialogues.speaker: INT. WRITING SHED. DAY
dialogues.text: A tiny hut the size of a closet. Eleanor sits in a green velvet armchair with a board covered in billiard-table fe across her lap. She is writing on a yellow legal pad. Drawings and photographs of different species of penguin pinned all over the walls around her, along with dozens o pictures of her observing and photographing them in the arctic. Ned walks past the window carrying his mop and a bucket o scapy water. Eleanor hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Ned? What are you doing? Ned stops and looks to Eleanor. Pause.  40.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Steve gave me a few assignments to finish before lunch, and I wanted to get right on them -- first day and all. Eleanor frowns. Ned sees a small live penguin chewing on sardine in a wicker cage next to Bleanor’s chair. Ned loo surprised. He points at the penguin.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Can that gentleman survive here?

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: (distractedly) Him? Yeah. Ned shakes his head, impressed. He speaks quietly to the penguin:

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: You must be perspiring under that tuxedo, my little companion. Eleanor stares at Ned’s pilot’s cap. She has a distant lo in her eye.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Kentucky. I once had a dirty weekend in Kentucky.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (hesitates) A dirty weekend? What’s that? Eleanor looks at Ned curiously. She starts to go on but stops. She says frankly:

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: A dirty weekend is when you're in a place where you’re not supposed to be, with someone you’re not supposed to be with. Can I say something to you as your potential stepmother?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (caught off-guard) I'd be delighted.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Be careful. OK? Ned hesitates. He looks at his mop and says vaguely:  41.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: I won’t walk on it ‘til after it’s dry.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: I‘m not talking about the floor.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LABORATORY. DAY
dialogues.text: An underground room filled with out-dated computers and recording equipment. A large window looks into a deep swimming pool with the killer whale in it. Wolodarsky sit a comer mixing chemicals, which rapidly change colors. Zissou and Jane sit across from each other at a metal des Zissou wears his Team Zissou shirt and matching aquamarin pants with navy blue stripes down the sides. Jane has a t recorder and a little notebook in front of her. Zissou is eating a banana.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: May I turn this on?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (chewing) Fire one. Jane presses record on her tape recorder. She says direct with earnest concern:

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: So what happened, in your opinion?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: {pause) What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Well, don’t you think the public perception of your work has --

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (frowns) That’s your first question? I thought this was supposed to be a puff-piece.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Should we come back to it?

dialogues.speaker: Z21ISSOU
dialogues.text: (sighs) Yeah.  42.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: OK. Is it true this is going to be your last voyage?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (stunned) Wow. No comment. Who told you that? No, goddammit -- I’m only fifty-two. Let’s warm up with some stock dialogue, OK? Favorite color: blue. Favorite food: sardines.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: How do you feel about part 1 of your new film?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (pause) Why? How do you feel about part 1 of my new film?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) Well, I’m honest, you know. I don’t think I should --

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Just say it.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (pause) I thought aspects of it seemed slightly fake. Fake in the sense that --

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Wolodarsky, you want to take five? Wolodarsky looks at Zissou. He hesitates. He gets up carr a beaker of bubbling liquid and goes out of the room. Zis turns on Jane and says aggressively:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Did it seem fake when my best friend got bitten in half right in front of me? And then eaten alive? Screaming? Jane looks stricken. Zissou points at her and says brutal

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I think you're fake. I think you’re a phony and a bad reporter. How does that feel? Tell me something: does this seem fake?  43. Zissou makes a face expressing pure, animal rage. Jane sh at him:

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: How dare you? This entire article was my idea! No one else gives a shit!

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (disturbed) What about Si Perlman?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Are you joking? He’s not even covering my expenses! Pause. Zissou says carefully:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: You’re taking something out on me. Jane looks confused. She turns away and tears suddenly st down her face. Zissou hesitates. ZISsoU Stop crying. What’s the deal here? I’m just trying to defend myself. Jane looks back to Zissou, furious.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Well, you did a great job. Congratu- lations. You’1l make a terrific father.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GARDEN. DAY
dialogues.text: Ned comes around the corner, onto the path, carrying two bags of trash. He stops suddenly. Klaus is in front of him, blocking the way.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: So you really think you're a Zissou?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (pause) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Well, you travelled a long way for I don’t know, sonny.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: That’s true, but it’s important to me.  44.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, a lot of things are important to some of us around here, sonny.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Klaus, don’t call me --

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: And another thing: it’s the Steve Zissou show. It’s not the Ned show. Klaus slaps Ned briskly in face. Ned looks stunned.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (pause) I do, sir. Klaus turns away and starts up the path. The garden lamps flicker on.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Klaus, if you ever touch me again I'll kick your goddamn teeth out. Is that understood? Klaus stops. He looks back to Ned. He laughs to himself s consciously and says, trying to sound intimidating while searching for the words:

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Not if I don’t see you first, sonny.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ZISSOU HOUSE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ned’s bedroom. Zissou stands in the doorway with a small cardboard box in his hand. He is dressed in his striped pajamas. Ned sits on the edge of the bed, looking down at floor.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: We got to watch ourselves around this dane character. Don’t tell her anything personal, and if you’re in doubt about something, change the subject and look for me. This bull-dyke’s got something against us.  45.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (without looking up) I don’t think she’s a lesbian. She’s pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Bull-dykes can get pregnant. Anyway, I’d back-out now, but we need the press. See you in the morning. Zissou starts to close the door. Ned finally looks up.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Steve? Zissou stops and waits. Ned says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: When did you first hear about me? Zissou looks away. He thinks for a minute. He looks back Ned.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Around five years ago, I guess. I read it in an article about myself.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (pause) Did you believe it?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (shrugs) It was in the paper. I assumed they checked their facts.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Then why didn’t you contact me?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (pause) Because I hate fathers, and I never wanted to be one. Silence. Ned nods. Zissou goes out and closes the door. H immediately opens it again.

dialogues.speaker: Z1SSOU
dialogues.text: I forgot. Your correspondence stock came in. Zissou sets the little box on the table. He goes out and closes the door. Ned walks over to the box and opens it.  46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pale blue notecard with Kingsley (Ned) Zissou engraved across the top.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Ned staring at the card for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CORRIDOR. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Jane stands at the end of the hallway talking on a wall- mounted telephone. She sounds depressed and anxious:

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Hi, Ross. We started this morning. It went pretty weird, but I still feel strongly there’s a story in this. It might not be a comeback like I was predicting, but something’s going to happen. He’s got a son I’ve never heard of. Anyway, I’11 forward some pages to you through the copy department. (pause) You were probably right, though. What am I doing here? I miss you, and -- God, I don’t know, Ross. Where are you? Jane looks down at the floor. She shakes her head. Her vo cracks as she says:

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Listen, I’m not leaving this message. I don’t even know why I’m still pregnant. All my best, Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand holding a Polaroid of Ned in a Team Zissou uniform standing at the end of a dock with the Belafonte behind h A second hand brings in another Polaroid of Ned (closer a now wearing a red Zissou cap) and holds it next to the fi

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou and Ned standing together at the end of the dock looking at the Polaroids. Ned still wears the Team Zissou uniform. Zissou swings his thumb toward someone down the beach.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: The script girl uses these for continuity.  47. Ned nods. Zissou tucks the Polaroids into his pocket. He holds out a Glock and a box of bullets.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Oh. Uh --

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: No exceptions. Everyone has one. Ned is reluctant to take the pistol. Zissou yells to Anne Marie lying on a towel on a chaise longue on the beach reading a paperback copy of The Exorcist. There is a Pola camera and a bottle of sunscreen on a basket beside her.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Anne-Marie! Do the interns get Glocks?

dialogues.speaker: ANNE-MARIE
dialogues.text: (turning a page) No. They all share one.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (vindicated) Take it, Ned. Ned takes the Glock. Klaus’ voice shouts from an intercom mounted on a post:

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Steve? You there? Oseary on line one! Pause. Zissou turns suddenly and sprints full-speed towar his office. Ned runs after him.

dialogues.speaker: INT. OFFICE. DAY
dialogues.text: Zissou is behind his desk with an old speakerphone in fro of him. Ned sits across from him. Drakoulias’ voice comes over the line:

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I spoke with Larry Amin, and it’s a pass. Silence. Zissou nods.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: In other words, you fucked us.  48.

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Let’s not cast stones at one another, my boy. (screaming) Do you hear me, dammit!

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (screaming) No, I don’t! I told you how to play it, and you just --

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (screaming) Listen here, mate! If you think --

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: May I interrupt for a moment? Zissou looks to Ned. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Who in the blazes is that?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: It’s me. Ned. Maybe this is nothing, maybe it’s something. I don’t know your problems -- I don’t know -- but I just inherited $275,000. Would that amount make any difference? Zissou stares at Ned. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What sort of expression is the lad wearing on his face?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LABORATORY. DAY
dialogues.text: Zissou and Ned walk quickly across a narrow metal bridge the killer whale tank. Zissou looks back to Ned and says:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Can you fly a chopper? Ned hesitates. Zissou opens a metal cabinet filled with snorkels and diving masks. He takes a set of keys off a little hook inside the door and closes it.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: I have, but I’m not licensed in any way, shape, or form.  49.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (handing Ned the keys) Good. Let’s go. Zissou walks back across the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. COMPOUND. DAY
dialogues.text: The yellow Team Zissou helicopter flies out from behind o of the buildings and banks out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HELICOPTER. DAY
dialogues.text: Ned flies the chopper over the water. He wears a Team Zis flight-suit. Zissou sits in the seat beside him. The engi is extremely loud and makes erratic, grinding sounds. Ned looks uneasy. He yells over the sound of the motor:

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: When was this whirlybird last serviced?

dialogues.speaker: Z2ISSOU
dialogues.text: I don’t know! Klaus is supposed to check it every six months!

dialogues.speaker: INT. HIGH-RISE. DAY
dialogues.text: Drakoulias’ office on the top floor of a twelve-story building overlooking the city. Every surface in the room made of white marble, set at right angles, except for the chairs and sofas, which are black leather. There is a gigantic marble desk with one black pen on it in the midd of the room. Zissou and Ned stand at the window, waiting. The door opens. Drakoulias walks quickly into the room an starts talking. He is followed by a well-groomed thirty-y old man in a Savile Row suit. He is Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: You're back on the water, boys. The wire transfer came in from Kentucky straight away, and Jackman and Wordsley will gap- finance the rest -- but there’s a few hooks on it, so take a pew for a spell. Drakoulias sits at his desk and motions for Zissou and Ne join him, which they immediately do.

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: One. The bank’s going to need a drug screen from everyone on the crew before they’1ll release the funds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A piss test?

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: Yes, a piss test. Two. A stooge from the bond company’s going to be riding with you for the whole shoot to keep you on budget.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Who’s the stooge?

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: A chap by the name of Bill Ubell, and there’s not a damn thing you can do about it. Three. They want your word you do not intend to kill that shark or whatever it is, if it actually exists.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (pause) I’m going to fight it, but I’11 let it live. How about my dynamite?

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: Phillip? Dynamite? Phillip nods and writes something on a little card. Drakoulias stands up, crosses to the door, and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: I’m off to Zurich, boys. A forty-five-year-old man in a short-sleeved shirt and ti sits in the waiting room just outside the office. He wear aviator-style eyeglasses and has a briefcase in his lap. is Bill Ubell. He stands up and comes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: Mr. Ubell, I’d like you to know Steve Zissou, and this is our equity partner, Ned.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ELEVATOR. DAY
dialogues.text: Zissou, Ned, and Bill ride down through the center of a winding staircase in an old, wrought-iron elevator car.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I hope you’re not going to bust our chops, Bill.  51.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (hurt) Why would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Because you’re a bond company stooge.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (wounded) Well, I’m also a human being. Zissou hesitates. He nods. He says gently:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: All right. I take that back. Yeah. Zissou puts out his hand, palm down.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Let's have some teamsmanship. Zissou bumps Ned with his elbow and whistles. Ned puts hi hand on top of Zissou'’s. Zissou and Ned both look to Bil Bill reluctantly puts his hand on top of theirs. Zissou shouts abruptly:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Ho!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zissou, Ned, and Bill speed in a Zodiak motorboat from th Belafonte -- with the helicopter on its landing platform to the marina at Pescespada Island. Zissou and Eleanor chart a course on a large chart spread across a table. Zissou draws a route with a red Sharpie, sticks pins in different spots, spins a compass, and move around a tiny model of the Belafonte. Eleanor shakes her head, rearranges everything, and opens a bottle of liquid paper. Zissou leads his crew on a brisk run along the beach. He to Jane shortly as they pass by her in the garden. Ned st and jogs in place. He gives Jane a tiny sand-dollar. It glitters. Ned says something and Jane laughs. Zissou look back and shouts at Ned. Ned sprints to catch up. Klaus peels a strip off a chart on the wall labelled Shoo Schedule. He throws the strip out the window. Bill sits a desk in the corridor typing numbers into a calculator and making notations in ledger books. Wolodarsky sits in a br  52. closet playing two Casio keyboards simultaneously. A piec tape on the door says Recording in Progress. Vikram stand front of a window filming Pelé, who holds a color chart i front of his face. Renzo sits in a corner eating a tuna f sandwich with his headphones on. Eleanor studies a bullet board labelled Stunt Work. She puts an X across the words Skydive into Volcano. The interns stand in a row outside Zissou walks in front of them yelling like a drill sergea They look terrified. Anne-Marie quickly loads a Polaroid camera with film. She presses stop on her stopwatch and l at it. She is topless.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Pelé jams a stick of dynamite into a pile of rocks underwater. He jumps into a trench with a snorkel still i his mouth and crouches next to Wolodarsky. There is a lar crate of explosives beside them. Wolodarsky spits on his fingers and rubs two wires together. The dynamite explode blasting a shower of water and fish into the air. Wolodar makes a notation on a clipboard. Ogata shows Ned how to adjust the valves on his aqualung. They put in their mouthpieces and tip-over backwards into killer whale tank.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou and Klaus giving Ned C.P.R. Ogata holds down Ned’s feet. Zissou counts off the beats as he presses on Ned’s chest:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: One, two, three. Klaus blows into Ned’s mouth. Zissou goes again.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: One, two, three. Klaus blows into Ned's mouth. Ned wakes up suddenly, coug and choking.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Here he is! Here he comes! Ned? Are you

dialogues.speaker: OK
dialogues.text: Ned nods, gasping, and sits up. Zissou holds him by the shoulders. Everyone looks nervous but relieved.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: OK, give him some room. He’s OK. Just drank a little water, that’s all.  53. Zissou turns and sees Vikram filming the scene. He looks at the sky, then back to Vikram.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: How you shooting this, Vikram? Wide-open? Eleanor watches from the window of her writing hut.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LOUNGE, NIGHT
dialogues.text: A rec-room with a ping-pong table, air hockey, and a Team Zissou pinball machine. Ned sits on an old pale blue, vin sofa watching a beat-up, portable television set on top o foot-locker. He is dressed in a bathrobe and has a thermometer in his mouth. Klaus, Ogata, Pelé, and Wolodar sit around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The television set. A tape of an early episode of The Lif Aquatic is playing. There is a shot of the Belafonte trap in a polar ice floe. The crew is on deck in Team Zissou parkas and furs. Zissou serves them hot chocolates with marshmallows. Ogata looks to be about twelve years old, a Klaus has a mohawk. Zissou announces in voice-over:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: As always -- even in the most challenging circumstances -- the members of Team Zissou find ways to keep morale high.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NORTH POLE. DAY
dialogues.text: Zissou in his swimsuit swings on a rope from the ship’s d winch out over a glacier hot-spring. He lets go, does a double back-flip, and hits the steaming water. The crew bursts into cheering and applause. They surround Zissou, treading water as he comes up laughing. Zissou suddenly frowns. He shouts:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Quiet! Hold it! Shhh! Zissou waves his hands for silence. Everyone goes quiet a stares at him curiously. Zissou listens for a moment. He urgently:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Was that a distress bark? Is something wounded out there?  54.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GLACIER. DAY
dialogues.text: Esteban, Klaus, Pelé, and Wolodarsky stand over a deep ch pulling a rope through a pulley.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We quickly locate the source of the mysterious cry. Esteban calls out each pull in French. Zissou emerges out the crevasse covered in snow and is hoisted onto the ice. cradles a sleeping, white animal in his arms, stroking it fur. Esteban kneels down close to Zissou.

dialogues.speaker: ESTEBAN
dialogues.text: What is she, Steve?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (whispering) A wild snow mongoose. We thought they were extinct. Her ankle’s broken. Ogata, run get some hot milk -- and put these guys in the incubator. Zissou produces two pink baby mongoose pups. They whimper quietly. Ogata scoops them carefully into his mittens and hurries back toward the boat.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We radio for the emergency transport of our rare, beautiful, new friends.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Ned, Klaus, Ogata, Pelé, and Wolodarsky in the lounge. Kl points at the screen and says wistfully:

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: That’‘s what it used to be like. Ogata nods. Klaus sees Zissou standing in the doorway, watching blankly from the shadows. Klaus hesitates. Zisso turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ZISSOU HOUSE. NIGHT
