dialogues.text: You know I’m not big on apologizing, so I’ll just skip it, if it’s all the same to you.

dialogues.speaker: 421SSOU
dialogues.text: Anyway, I’m sorry. I know I haven’t been at my best this past decade.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: (gently) That’s true, but let’s just say it’s all xight and -- leave it be. Pause. Zissou flicks the lizard onto the floor and walks outside.  108.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TERRACE. DAY
dialogues.text: Dusk. The balcony of Villa Hennessey looks out over a cli high above the sea. The Spanish man exercises on another balcony below. Zissou stands at the railing and says sadl

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: What happened to me? Did I lose my talent? Am I ever going to be good again? Eleanor comes out to join Zissou. She smokes a brown cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Well, it doesn’t matter, anyway. This is probably the last adventure I’ve got in me. I was hoping to go out in a flash of blazes, but now I think I'll just head home -- unless you’re planning to sell the island.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: (pause) I wonder how much I could get for it?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: In this market? Oh, Eleanor. (sighs) You were probably right, all along. We should’ve had a kid together. Of course, you were kind of already on the edge of being too old, but I guess maybe that’s a cop-out.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: It’s worse than a cop-out. I was thirty- four. Zissou nods. He takes out a joint and puts it in his mout He says sincerely:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: It‘s good to see you, Eleanor.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: You, too. Zissou leans forward and lights his joint off the cigaret in Eleanor’s mouth.  109. INT. NED’S CABIN. NIGHT The Belafonte. Ned’s room is dark. The door opens. Zissou comes in and closes it behind him. He looks at Ned and Ja asleep in the bunk. He says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I’m about to blow my stack. I turn my back, and the bullshit begins. Ned opens his eyes. He sits up quickly.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Ned, you’re a scumbag. Zissou turns on the lights. Jane wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: And, Jane, you’re a goddamn liar.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (furious) What the fuck are you doing in here?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: What the £ are you doing in here? I warned you before about being in the wrong cabins. You were supposed to go home.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Well, you convinced me to stay and finish the story.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (pause) Is it still the cover?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (angrily) I don’t fucking know. Ned gets out of bed. He wears white boxer shorts. He puts his Team Zissou pants.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Don’t you dare put on that uniform.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (hesitates) It’s all I have with me.  110.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I told you I have a little bit of a thing for her, dammit. Not this one, I said.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: You said, Not this one, Klaus.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: {points to Ned) So you heard me.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: You're too old for me, Steve.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (pause) Well, you're pregnant!

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I don’t respect either one of you, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (thrown) Well, I know why you don’t respect me, but why don’t you respect him -- because he didn’t hit me when I burst in here? (to Ned) I’1l tell you one thing: you never would've gotten away with calling me a scumbag in my cabin.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: I never would’ve wanted to.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I meant you and Klaus. He’s been a dick to Ned.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (pause) You’re right. What's the deal with that?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (to Zissou) May I have a word with you privately? Zissou shouts:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Yeah!  lil. Zissou and Ned go out the door and close it behind them. Klaus stands at the end of the hallway in his striped pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Are you two fighting?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I'11 deal with you later! (to Ned) Follow me. Ned follows Zissou up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Look, Steve. I know we both like her, and you're angry and embarrassed, but -- ZISsou You think that’s what this is about? Shit, Ned. What's that bull-dyke been telling you?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (suddenly) All right. I’m going to warn you now. Be a gentleman. Zissou and Ned walk down a corridor into the library. The intern with curly black hair and his arm in a sling sits sofa reading a copy of Oceanographic Explorer with a pict of Hennessey on the cover. Zissou sees him and frowns.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? I thought all you interns walked out on me.

dialogues.speaker: INTERN
dialogues.text: I want to help you find that shark.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (defiantly) Goddammit ! Zissou grips the intern’s shoulder. The intern grimaces a cries out in agony. Zissou lets go of him.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Thank you, intern. You’re getting an A. Zissou and Ned walk out of the library and go up another of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: His name’s Nico.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (confused) Who? Zissou and Ned walk through the laboratory and go into th kitchen. Vikram stands in the pantry door with a camera o his shoulder. Ned sees him.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Hello, Vikram. Zissou turns and sees Vikram filming them. He screams:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Give me that camera! I’m going to smash it over your head! Zissou lunges at Vikram. Vikram ducks out the back of the pantry and disappears around the corner. Zissou yells:

dialogues.speaker: Z2ISSOU
dialogues.text: cut! Zissou and Ned walk through the chart room and up another of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I misread you, man. I’m going to have to re-think some shit.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (of fended) You don’t know me. You never wanted to know me. I’m just a character in your film.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (hesitates) It’s a documentary. It’s all really happening.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Well, damn you for that. Zissou looks confounded. He shakes it off. He and Ned go the door, onto the main deck. Pelé sits by the railing strumming his guitar. Ogata and Renzo are with him. Zisso yells:  113.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Go to sleep, you sons of bitches! Ogata, Pelé, and Renzo look startled but make no move to Pause. Zissou turns away and climbs up the ladder to the of the look-out tower. Ned follows him. They stand high above the ship in silence.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: That pregnant slut’s been playing us like a cheap fiddle. Pause. Ned says in a steely voice:

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: That’s it. I’m going to fight you, Steve. Zissou feints to one side and sucker-punches Ned in the f Ned hits the floor. Zissou shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: You never say, I’m going to fight you, Steve. You just smile and act natural -- and then you sucker-punch him. Ned stands up and stares at Zissou.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: You fight your way, and I'll fight mine.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (patronizing) Listen, Ned. Don’t try to -- Ned sucker-punches Zissou in the face. Zissou hits the fl He puts his finger to his lip and shows Ned a drop of blo

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I think your Team Zissou ring might’ ve caught me on the lip. Ned takes off his ring and puts it into his pocket. Jane comes out onto the tower and stands behind Ned, chewing g Zissou gets up. He says simply:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: You call yourself my son, but I just don’t see it. (shrugs) It’s nothing personal. Ned looks wounded. Zissou points at Jane and snaps:  114.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: What do you want? Pause. Jane blows a bubble, then pops it back into her mo She says calmly:

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (annoyed) That’s so arrogant. That’s -- screw off! Jane shrugs. Ned shakes his head and says, humiliated:

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: I can’t believe I asked if I could call you Dad. What was I thinking? Of course, you said no.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (pause) I let you call me Steevsy. It sounds better.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (exploding) It doesn’t mean the same thing! Silence. Zissou looks disturbed. Jane puts her arms aroun Ned’s waist. Ned says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: I hadn’t planned to mention this, but just to set the record straight: a week before she killed herself, my mother told me you’d known about me since the day I was born. Is that a fact? (long pause) Answer me! Is that a fact?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: That’s a fact.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: I didn’t come looking for you because I wanted to join your crew. I ought to have stayed in Kentucky, where I belong -- (suddenly) -- and now I’ve made a fool of myself.  11s. Ned turns away sadly. The three-legged dog starts barking crazily on the deck below. Zissou frowns. He goes over to railing and looks down. Eleanor stands with her suitcases and a steel briefcase a the prow of the ship over a ladder that comes up from the water. A harbor taxi idles alongside the Belafonte. Elean points at the dog and says sternly:

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Quiet! The dog stops barking and sits. Eleanor looks up to Zisso Ned, and Jane on the look-out tower. She shouts:

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Somebody pay for this water taxi! Pause. Zissou says to Ned:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: You got any petty cash on you?

dialogues.speaker: INT. CARGO HOLD. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The entire crew sits around Zissou and Eleanor at a foldi table with Eleanor’s steel briefcase open in front of the It is filled with neatly stacked 100 dollar bills. Eleano has a telephone receiver to her ear, listening. Ned stand alone in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Klaus, remind me to send Eleanor's parents a thank-you note on the good correspondence stock. Klaus nods. Eleanor addresses the group:

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: This is the message we received earlier tonight on our answering machine at Pescespada Island. Eleanor places the receiver on a cradle connected to a speakerphone. Bill’s voice comes over the line. There are jungle sounds and static on it.

dialogues.speaker: BILL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Bill Ubell, here. I'm on a pay-phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answering machine at Pescespada Island. There is a photograph of the original Team Zissou, with Zissou and Esteban front and center, on the wall behind it.

dialogues.speaker: BILL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I'm still blindfolded, and my arms are bound, but a young boy has been kind enough to assist me. There's not much chance I'll get another opportunity to call, so I thought I'd ask if -- (suddenly) No, no, I’m just talking to my wife! Our daughter’s graduating from high school and -- Bill switches into rapid Indonesian and the line goes dea

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The cargo hold. Eleanor hangs up the speakerphone.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Well, thanks for checking in, Bill. Maybe next time you could let us know where you're at.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Based on the quality of the connection, the variety of the wildlife in the background, and the elapsed time between Mr. Ubell‘s capture and this message -- there’s a good chance he’s on one of the Ping Islands. Eleanor unfolds a map of the area onto the table. She indicates a circle with her finger around a cluster of ti islands.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: There was once a four-star hotel on Little Ping, but the entire island was destroyed by monsoon five years ago. It’s been uninhabited ever since. Zissou sighs. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I know the place. Hotel Citroén. Cubbie, I want to go on the record. (with admiration) Eleanor’s always been the brains behind Team Zissou. By the way, are you going to (more)  117. ZISSoU (cont 'd)} put in a good description of the command center I set up down here? Jane ignores this question. Zissou turns to the rest of t crew.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Well, are we clear, gang? Set a course for Little Ping Island, full-speed ahead.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (coldly) You’1l need to hire a team of mechanics and re-build the engine first, of course.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (hesitates) I know. I’m saying, after that. Ned walks out of the room. Zissou and Eleanor stand aside the meeting breaks up.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Just because I‘ve decided to save your neck again and help you do this rescue doesn’t mean you’ve won me back.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (quietly) OK. Wolodarsky sits at the radar monitor across the room. A b glows near the center of the screen.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GALLEY. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Eleanor cooks grilled cheese sandwiches with sardines on stove. Jane sits at the kitchen table drinking a glass of milk. They both wear bathrobes. Ned stands on deck outsid the window smoking his pipe, looking out across the harbo Eleanor sees Jane watching Ned affectionately. Pause. She points to him with a spatula.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: I think Ned’s the politest person I've met in my life. Jane nods and smiles sadly. Eleanor brings over the sandwiches and sits down next to her.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Thanks .  118. Eleanor nods. She points at Jane’s stomach.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Is the father out of the picture?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. I was actually kind of terrified to have this baby -- (realizing) -- but right now I’m not really scared of anything. (pause) Maybe it’s my hormones.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: That makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: What’s going to happen to you and Steve?

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Nobody knows. Eleanor goes to the refrigerator and gets a pitcher of mi She refills Jane's glass. She sits back down and stares a Jane for a minute. She says finally:

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: I’m going to tell you something confiden- tially, which won’t be mentioned again. I’m pretty sure I’m the only person that can say this, including Steve. Never mind how I found out -- I’m a scientist. It’s the thing that puzzles me about Ned’s situation.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Zissou shoots blanks.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: {pause) I think maybe it’s because he’s spent half his life underwater.  119. Jane nods thoughtfully. She looks to Ned outside.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Ned staring into the distance. Jane and Eleanor watch him through the kitchen porthole in the background. Ned extinguishes his pipe and shakes out the ashes. Little sp float around him. He slips the pipe into his pocket and g inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zissou, Renzo, and Wolodarsky sit at the flat-bed editing console.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Let's try track three against picture. Wolodarsky presses play on a reel-to-reel tape recorder. piece of brooding, suspenseful electronic music begins. R rolls the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen of the flat-bed. The first image is of Ogata, alert in the observation bub looking out as the ship barely slips by among the tangled ranches of a coral reef. He says something into a walkie- talkie.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: A treacherous reef surrounds the Ping Islands, warning intruders to keep their distance.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BRIDGE. DAY
dialogues.text: Zissou listens by walkie-talkie on the bridge. He gives a command to Pelé. Pelé quickly spins the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Today, we discover one of its victims off the coast of Ping Three.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OCEAN. DAY
dialogues.text: The Belafonte slowly approaches the smoldering wreckage o Hennessey’s research vessel, half-sunken in the bay. It l deserted. The crew of the Belafonte watches, frightened a disturbed. Zissou smiles slightly.  120.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Our colleague Alistair Hennessey and his crew are nowhere to be found.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. RESEARCH VESSEL. DAY
dialogues.text: Zissou poses for the camera standing on the prow of Hennessey’s ship, which juts vertically out of the water. has a determined look on his face. He gives a thumbs-up.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We will land at dawn.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Wolodarsky turning a knob on the tape recorder. The music fades out. Renzo stops the film. Zissou nods. He looks to Wolodarsky and says in a determined voice:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Not bad. We’ll temp it with that, anyway. Wolodarsky looks pleased.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BEACH. DAY
dialogues.text: Dawn. A forgotten beach with demolished cabanas and tatte umbrellas stuck in the sand. A torn poster with an image the resort as it once was hangs rustling on a crooked boa The sea is calm at low tide. The three-legged dog paddles from the surf and walks onto the beach. It shakes the wat off itself. The head of a diver in a mask and a Team Zissou wet suit up out of the ccean inside the breakers. Seven other dive emerge one by one and advance on the shore. The first diver to reach land takes off his mask. He is Zissou. He scans the tree-line with a spear-gun at the re He lets out a wild yelp. Ned, Klaus, Ogata, Renzo, Pelé, Wolodarsky take off their masks and aqualungs. They check their Glocks. Pelé helps Wolodarsky inspect a bundle of dynamite. Vikram films the scene. Zissou sees the dog digging in the sand. He whistles.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Cody! The dog goes over to Zissou. Zissou and his team run into jungle.  121.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARSH. DAY
dialogues.text: Zissou leads his team through a rice paddy and emerges fr the mud among a herd of grazing water buffaloes. He looks his ankle and frowns. He pulls off a leech.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! Swamp leeches! Everybody! Check for swamp leeches and pull them off of you! Zissou pulls leeches off his arms, hands, feet, and neck. others check, but no one else has been bitten. Zissou beg to notice this.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Nobody else got hit? What’s the deal? I’m the only one? The others shrug and shake their heads. Zissou seems anno Wolodarsky pulls a leech from behind Zissou’s ear. He examines it closely and touches it with his tongue. He pu it into a tiny, Zip-loc specimen bag. Zissou looks at him like he is insane. Wolodarsky explains:

dialogues.speaker: WOLODARSKY
dialogues.text: These have curative properties.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Well, yeah, I know, but they probably taste like shit. Zissou whistles, and they continue through the jungle. cuT TO: The seven divers and the dog hidden in the bushes on the of a clearing with their Glocks out and ready. A five-sto cement hotel that looks like a bunker stands across from them. It is overgrown with vines and trees, and most of i windows have been smashed out. There is an empty, Olympic sized swimming pool with dirty water and algae at the bot Small monkeys run and swing on branches in the courtyard. destroyed golf cart lies on its side, partially buried, w a red and white striped snake winding around its steering wheel. A sign above the front entrance says Hotel Citroén Zissou shakes his head. He says sadly:  122.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: What a shame. They had a bartender here, Kino, made the best rum cannonball I ever tasted. Zissou sighs. He turns to Vikram.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: You ready, Vikram? Vikram holds up his light meter and takes a reading. He n Zissou looks to everyone else and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Should we do this? No one responds. Zissou runs out into the clearing. His g follows him in single-file around the side of the hotel. cut across a deserted tennis court with a fallen net and plants growing out of it. They quickly climb a chain-link fence and drop down into a desolate rose garden. They go inside through the service entrance.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOTEL. DAY
dialogues.text: Zissou and his team run through the kitchen, down a back corridor, and up the fire stairs, anxiously checking ever closet and corner. They hand-signal to each other elabora and continuously.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HOTEL. DAY
dialogues.text: Zissou and his team come out onto the roof. Zissou cocks head to one side abruptly. He licks his pinky and holds i in the air. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: The barometer’s falling. It’s going to rain in five minutes. We got to be quick.

dialogues.speaker: OGATA
dialogues.text: Well, where are they? ZISsoU Unknown. Split into two groups. I‘1ll take Ned, Ogata, and Wolodarsky.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: (hurt) Thanks. Thanks a lot for not picking me.  123. Klaus walks away to the edge of the roof, shaking his hea with his back to the group. Zissou sighs. He goes over to Klaus and stands behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: We’re smack in the middle of a lightning strike rescue op, Klaus. What's the deal? Klaus shrugs and says without looking back to Zissou:

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: I’m sick of being on B-squad.

dialogues.speaker: 2ISSOU
dialogues.text: (surprised) Listen, you may be on B-squad, but you’re the B-squad leader. Zissou punches Klaus gently in the back. Klaus turns arou There are tears in his eyes. Zissou continues:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Don't you know me and Esteban always thought of you as our baby brother? Klaus nods. He shakes his head. He says, choked up:

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: I always thought of you two as my dads. Please, don’t let anyone make fun of me for saying so. Zissou hesitates. He hugs Klaus. ZISsoU I can’t guarantee that, Klausie, but I’1l try. Can we get on with the maneuvers now? There is a flash of lightning, then a thunderclap. Everyo looks up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou, Ned, Ogata, and Wolodarsky running silently down corridor. They open each hotel room and look inside with their guns drawn. Zissou shouts:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: You got something?  124.

dialogues.speaker: WOLODARSKY
dialogues.text: Not yet!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Klaus, Pelé, Renzo, and Vikram racing across a balcony al the front of the building. They peer into the windows. Kl yells:

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Anybody see anybody?

dialogues.speaker: PELE
dialogues.text: Empty!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou and his group convene with Klaus and the others at top of the main staircase above the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Klaus? Pirates?

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Zip. I think this whole place is deserted.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Shit! We played a bum hunch. Fuck! OK, let’s not get down on ourselves. There's still two more Ping Islands to check out, except I don’t know if we got enough gas to get there. Dammit, Steve! (depressed) This sucks. I’m disappointed in myself. Zissou sighs. He surveys the lobby below. It is filled wi trash, overturned furniture, and a huge chandelier which crashed onto the floor. The entire room appears to have b underwater at some point, and there are shells and seawee everywhere. The concierge desk remains intact. It has sta to rain outside. Zissou says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: My first wife, Jacqueline, and I spent our honeymoon here. (pause) Things are pretty different now. Zissou turns to Ned beside him. Ned looks to Zissou uncertainly. Zissou takes a deep breath. He motions down stairs and says loudly to the rest of the group:  125.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: All right. Let’s check out. Zissou starts down the staircase. He immediately slips on slick marble and tumbles hard, bouncing and rolling all t way down to the lobby. He lies on his back, sprawled out the wet paisley carpet. Everyone races down after Zissou. They circle around him. Vikram is filming. Zissou says calmly:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Did you get that, Vikram?

dialogues.speaker: VIKRAM
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Uh -- yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Good. We'll give them the reality this time. (utterly defeated) A washed up old man with no friends, no distribution deal, wife on the rocks, people laughing at him, feeling sorry for himself. Up until now we had a documentary about me being a shitty person -- (almost pleased) -- but now it’s actually sad. Can I have a word alone with my son, please? Everyone moves away leaving Ned kneeling over Zissou.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Not really. By the way, thanks for saving my life when that trunk was about to fall off the luggage rack and cold-cock me.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (pause) It probably wouldn’t’ve killed you.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Well, it would've left a hell of a knot. I've been trying to think of a nick-name that might mean the right thing. I came up with Papa-Steve. Ned hesitates. He nods sadly. He helps Zissou to his feet  126.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I never acknowledged your existence all those years. It won't happen again. I mean it. Zissou puts his hand around the back of Ned’s neck.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: You are my son to me. Almost more so. See, for me to meet a guy like you at this time in my life, it’s just -- Zissou starts to say something more, but stops. He looks at the floor and shrugs. Z2ISsou I don’t know. I want to communicate my feelings to you, but I think I might start to cry.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (gently) That’s OK. Klaus rings the bell at the reception desk on the other s of the lobby. Zissou and Ned look at him. He points to an open closet and says in a loud stage-whisper:

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Something’s in the coat-check.

dialogues.speaker: INT. COAT-CHECK. DAY
dialogues.text: A few faded wind-breakers and topcoats hang from a rod. Zissou tries a knob on a door at the back of the room. It locked. He knocks lightly and ducks away around the corne with his gun poised. There is a quiet tapping and squeaki from behind the door. Zissou motions to Ogata. Ogata hands him a crowbar. Zisso cracks open the door and looks inside.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LAUNDRY ROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: There are rows of rusted and dilapidated washing machines electric dryers along the walls. Bill sits with Hennessey Japanese television crew on folding metal chairs. They ar tied up and blindfolded, with duct tape over their mouths They look starved and half-conscious, and have been beate severely. Zissou runs over to Bill. He says hopefully:  127.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Billy? You OK? Zissou undoes Bill’s blindfold and carefully pulls the ta off his mouth. Bill says immediately in a parched, cracki voice:

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Did you get my message?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Yeah. It was kind of garbled. Ned and Klaus untie the Japanese television crew, who loo disoriented and terrified. Zissou says to Bill:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Where is everybody? When was the last time you heard from these screwballs?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (pause) Honestly? You lose track of time.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou and his group supporting Bill and the Japanese television crew as they exit the building. Zissou stands the revolving door, pushing it as each person goes throug He follows them out. He stops suddenly. There are ten fresh graves lined up in a row next to the front door. An Operation Hennessey hat hangs from a make- shift cross on each mound of dirt. Everyone waits in sile They look shocked. Klaus says nervously:

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Jesus. These pirates are monsters.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Well, yeah, but remember I shot one of their guys in the neck last week and killed him, so I think we’re OK, too. (suddenly) Where's Cody?

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOTEL. DAY
dialogues.text: Zissou comes back inside through the revolving door. He s the three-legged dog across the lobby, near the bottom of stairs, staring transfixed at a door, growling.  128. Zissou frowns. He yells:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Cody? The dog does not respond. Pause. Zissou walks slowly towa him. Ned watches from outside through a glass door. Zisso stands over the dog. He opens the door. Fifteen Indonesian men sit at a table smoking cigarettes playing cards in an abandoned ballroom. There are dollars euros, rupees, and yen crumpled and tossed in front of th Three other men cook turtle soup and rice over cans of Sterno. Another twenty-five or thirty men stand around wi shot-glasses in their hands. There are rifles, pistols, a machetes strewn across the tables and floor. There are ca of fuel and crates of stolen food and clothing stacked al the walls. There are piles of watches, television sets, pornographic videotapes, jewelry, and bottles of liquor. The pirates are all staring at Zissou. Hennessey sits amo them holding a hand of cards in front of him. His hair ha been shorn off, and there are cuts and scratches all over scalp and face. He has lost several teeth. He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: HENNESSEY
dialogues.text: Steven, are you rescuing me? Pause. Zissou nods reluctantly. Hennessey looks deeply touched. He drops his cards on the table and says to the pirates:

dialogues.speaker: HENNESSEY
dialogues.text: Fold. (to Zissou) What’s our next move? Zissou hesitates. A pirate across the table shoots Hennes Hennessey is knocked down flat on the floor. Zissou grima in horror. He ducks behind the staircase and struggles to his Glock out of its holster. The rest of the pirates scramble, grabbing weapons and shooting. Zissou shoots ba

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HOTEL. DAY
dialogues.text: The rain is coming down hard. Ned stands outside watching through the glass door as the gunfire starts inside. His widen. He turns to Klaus and yells:

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Klaus, bring the dynamite!  129. Klaus grabs the bundle of dynamite from Pelé. He and Ned into the lobby through the revolving door. The dog darts while it is still spinning. Bill, Ogata, Renzo, Pelé, Wolodarsky, and the Japanese television crew stand frozen at the edge of the empty swimming pool. The shooting inside bursts into a frenzy. Ogata and Pelé exchange a look. They draw their Glocks. T is a large explosion inside the hotel. Pause. Zissou, Ned, and Klaus run out, dragging Hennessey who limps and hops. They are all completely covered in bl soot, and Klaus is on fire. Hennessey is bloody. Smoke po from the lobby through the revolving door. Klaus rapidly peels off the top of his burning wet suit. His skin is cl and white beneath it. He stamps out the flames. Zissou shouts:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: They’re in there, after all! Run! Go! Move! Now! Zissou and his group sprint panicking back into the jungl

dialogues.speaker: EXT. JUNGLE. DAY
dialogues.text: Zissou leads everyone across a narrow footbridge over a gorge. He says to Hennessey as they run:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Vikram got some great footage of your boat out there. I guess it’s totalled, huh?

dialogues.speaker: HENNESSEY
dialogues.text: Perhaps, but we’re extremely well- insured. I’1l probably come out ahead, in the end -- although we‘ll obviously have to crew-up from scratch next time. (quietly) They made soup out of my research turtles. Zissou sees a half-destroyed poster for the Ping Invitati pasted-up at the end of the bridge next to a sign pointin the ninth hole. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: The ninth was a long four, but you had to hook it short before the bluff or you'd end up skipping out into that rice paddy.  130. A bullet zings past Zissou. He looks back. The pirates em shooting from the other side of the gorge. Pelé takes a bullet in the shoulder but keeps running. Zissou and his group duck behind an embankment. They exchange a volley o gunfire with the pirates. Zissou yells:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Ogata, do some first aid on Pelé! Klausie! Ned-o! Dig in and hold these rustlers off while I call in the rendez- vous! We'll meet on the beach! Zissou signals for the others to run. He starts to go him but hesitates. He points to Ned and Klaus.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: You’ re A-squad! Klaus gives Zissou an annoyed look. He and Ned continue t gunfight as Zissou takes off.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BEACH. DAY
dialogues.text: The skinny, thirteen-year-old Indonesian boy sits alone cooking a sea-crab on a spit over a campfire in the sand. hears gunfire from the jungle and looks up quickly. He frowns. He picks up a machete. Zissou races out of the trees. He shouts into a walkie- talkie:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Renzo! Renzo! Renzo! Anybody! Hello? Hella? Zissou frowns at the walkie-talkie. He shouts to Wolodars behind him:

dialogues.speaker: 2ISSOU
dialogues.text: This gizmo’s out of juice! Wolodarsky grabs the walkie-talkie out of Zissou’s hands looks at it. He smashes it onto the ground. Zissou sees t boy on the beach. He points his spear-gun at him. The boy stands up slowly as a look of panic comes over his face. Bill puts his hand in front of Zissou’s spear-gun and say with emotion:

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: That’s Cédric. He’s a friend.  131. Bill waves to the boy. The boy waves back with his machet Zissou says wistfully:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Merci, Cédric. (to Bill) Remind me, we‘ll send him a red cap and Speedo.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MARINA. DAY
dialogues.text: Zissou runs onto a deserted pier, followed by the rest of group. There is a large fishing boat moored near the shor The pirates’ speedboat sits tied at the end of the dock. Zissou yells to Pelé:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Grab the keys out of that fishing boat and throw them in the water! No, wait! They might have a spare set! Just blow it up! Pelé nods. He has a tourniquet on his arm. He climbs onto fishing boat and runs inside. Zissou directs everyone els board the speedboat. He gets in after them. Bill freezes. stares at something on deck at the prow. Zissou goes over him and looks. The yellow safe from the Belafonte sits in front of them. Ogata starts the speedboat’s motor. Pelé runs from the fishing beat, down the dock, and jumps into the speedboat The sounds of yelling and shooting grow louder from the jungle. Wolodarsky administers to Hennessey’s and Pelé’s bullet wounds. Zissou looks to the beach. Ned and Klaus sprint out of the jungle, firing back over their shoulders. Zissou opens fire at the trees to cover them. Ned and Klaus throw themselves onto the speedboat. Klaus guns it, and they pull away from the dock. Zissou s to Ned:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Well, it looks like we recovered your inheritance. Zissou motions to the safe. Ned nods, breathing heavily. Zissou kneels down and spins the dial left and right. He opens the safe. There is large hole blown in the back, an the ocean is beyond it. The safe is empty. Ned’s face app in the hole. He looks at Zissou through the safe.  132.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: All right. That’s it. I’m retired. Ned frowns. He shakes his head. He motions for Zissou to toward him. Zissou leans into the safe. Ned whispers in t darkness -- with a strange metallic echo magnifying his voice:

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: This might not be the right time or place to discuss this, Papa-Steve, but we've still got a shark to wrestle, and --

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: {curiously) The acoustics are unbelievable in here. Testing! Testing! Ned hesitates. The fishing boat explodes near the shore behind them. Zissou pulls himself out of the safe and run the back of the speedboat. He makes a congratulatory gest to Pelé. Pelé shrugs sheepishly. Zissou suddenly spots th three-legged dog stands alone at the end of the pier, wag its tail, watching them.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Oh, no! We got to go back and get -- Zissou turns around to his passengers. They all look at h blackened, bloody, and shell-shocked. Zissou sighs. He tu away again to look at the dog as it recedes behind them. waves to it and says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Good-bye, Cody. The pirates begin to appear on the beach in the distance by one as the speedboat races away from the marina. A Zod motorboat pulls up alongside them. Eleanor is at the whee with the curly-black-haired intern beside her. She waves Zissou enthusiastically. Zissou shrugs. Ogata throws a ru ring at one of the dolphin scouts swimming with the Zodia The dolphin catches the ring on its nose. The sound of a helicopter fades-in under the scene.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HELICOPTER. DAY
dialogues.text: Ned flies Zissou’s chopper low over the ocean. He wears a Team Zissou flight-suit. Zissou sits in the seat beside h looking out with his boy scout binoculars. They speak in voice-over:  133.

dialogues.speaker: NED, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: See, this represents the Belafonte, and here’s Pescespada Island, and this circle represents friendship, and the K here stands for Klaus.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou, Ned, and Klaus standing on the deck of the Belafo looking down at something in front of them. Zissou looks depressed. Ned has a needle and thread in one hand and a of scissors in the other. The sound of the chopper contin under the scene. Klaus turns to Ned suddenly. He seems moved.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Where’s your symbol, Ned?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Oh, I didn’t want to impose myself.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (sadly) Klaus is right. The flag needs a Ned symbol.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (pleased) Well, I suppose I could put an N on the side of this octopus.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (pointing) What’s that stand for over there?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou and Ned flying in the helicopter. They speak in vo over:

dialogues.speaker: NED, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That's Esteban. cuT TO: The cargo hold. An extremely large number of electronic p are scattered across a tarp on the floor. Zissou and Wolodarsky stand together in front of the disassembled scanning monitor. Sparks and smoke come out of it. The so of the chopper continues under the scene.  134.

dialogues.speaker: WOLODARSKY
dialogues.text: It was working OK until late last night, but now the whole tracking system’s gone completely on the fritz.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Screw it. We’ll sell it for scrap, along with the boat and the submarines. I’m going home.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Ned pulling Zissou aside in the stairwell. The sound of t chopper continues under the scene. Ned says firmly:

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Let’s take up the chopper and see what we find out there, anyway. I’ve got a feeling we can spot this fish froma hundred and eleven feet up.

dialogues.speaker: Z2ISSOU
dialogues.text: (defeated) Ned, I don’t know if I ever even saw this bastard.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (raising his voice) | IT have $275,000 invested in this damn production. Something ate Esteban, didn’t it? Now lead! Zissou looks at Ned curiously. Ned hesitates. He says hopefully:

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Right? Ned puts out his hand, palm down.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Right? Ned throws his hand up into the air.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Ho!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zissou and Ned flying in the helicopter. Zissou signals f Ned to alter their course. Ned nods.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Ned’s cabin. The sound of the chopper continues under the scene. Ned zips up his Team Zissou flight-suit and ties t laces on his boots. An envelope slips under the door into room. He picks it up and looks at it. He smiles. Zissou s in voice-over:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou and Ned coming out onto the upper deck of the Belafonte. The sound of the chopper continues under the scene. Ned wears a helmet with his flight-suit. He is rea his letter, smiling, as he and Zissou walk toward the helicopter platform.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: A letter from Jane.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (hesitates) What does she say?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (wistfully) Nothing to speak of. Ned waves to Jane standing in the wind on the look-out to Hennessey and Bill are beside her. Hennessey is shirtless with a large bandage over his mid-section. Jane smiles do at Ned and waves back to him.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou and Ned flying in the helicopter. Ned and Klaus sh in voice-over:

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Thank you for putting me on the flag, Ned!

dialogues.speaker: NED, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Of course, Klaus! It was my pleasure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned sitting in the chopper with the motor running. Zissou beside him. Klaus stands crouched over outside Ned’s door holds Ned’s arm and yelis earnestly over the sound of the engine:

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you stitched me onto the dolphin, and I want you to know how much it means to me!

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Well, I'm very pleased you liked it!

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: (sharply) You’re not listening to me! I didn’t just like it! Klaus hesitates. He salutes Ned formally. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou and Ned flying in the helicopter. Ned shouts gratefully in voice-over:

dialogues.speaker: NED, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yes, I do! Thank you, Klaus! Zissou reaches into his pocket and takes out an old, beat up envelope. He yells to Ned:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I’ve still got yours, of course!

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (confused) My what? Zissou takes a letter out of the envelope. He unfolds it hands it to Ned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A worn and faded typewritten note on graph paper. A young reads it in voice-over. Dear Captain Zissou, Iam 12 years old and live in Jawbone, Kentucky. A creek runs behind our house where I live with my mother (she me you once some years ago), and I collect and catalogue amphibians, reptiles, and insects. I don’t know what thi one is called, so I named it myself: There is a drawing in pencil of a gnat labelled Kentucky Zissou Fly. You are probably my one of if not the favorite person I have ever studied. I plan to be either: a) an oceanographer. b) an architect. c) a pilot. Thank you very much for your good work. Sincerely, Ned Plimpton Blue Star Cadet, Zissou Society P.S. Do you ever wish you could breathe underwater?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Ned with tears in his eyes. He says to Zissou:

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: I still wish I could breathe underwater.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (sadly) Me, too, Ned. Something catches Zissou’s attention in the water below. looks down the side of the chopper through his binoculars school of gently glowing pink fish swims rapidly in the shallows. Zissou turns to Ned and says excitedly:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Fluorescent snapper!

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (hesitates) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: A good sign! Last time we saw this big shit-kicker, he was -- The helicopter hits an air pocket and bounces once hard. There is a loud thump and a whoosh, followed by a metalli ping from above. Ned turns quickly to Zissou, concerned. Zissou looks uneasy. He points toward the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Something popped up there, didn’t it?  138. Ned nods and checks his instruments.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: I heard a pin snap loose in the -- There is a sudden, deafening groan overhead. The sound of rotor blades slows and then cracks. The chopper drops lik stone. Zissou and Ned brace themselves. Ned pulls on the controls. The helicopter rattles and rumbles vigorously. chunk of twisted steel rips into the roof, tearing open t cockpit. Glass shatters, and parts of the helicopter brea away. Ned turns to Zissou and smiles uncertainly. Zissou hesita Ned shrugs and smiles more broadly. Zissou reaches out to and puts his arm across Ned’s chest, bracing him. He says blankly:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: This is going to hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubbles rocket past them as they sink.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The ocean. Zissou surfaces among the wreckage and burning debris of the destroyed helicopter. There is blood all ov him. He sees Ned right away, draped calmly over a flotati cushion. His helmet is still on, and his face is white. Zissou yells to him:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Ned? Ned nods to Zissou and says evenly:

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Hey, Steevesy. Zissou swims over to Ned and pulls his helmet off.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: I think so. Ned slides off the flotation cushion and starts to slip beneath the surface. Zissou puts his arms around Ned’s bo and holds him above the water.  139.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: What happened? We hit something?

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Most likely not. I think maybe the push- rod failed.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Ned. I should've scrapped this chopper ten years ago.

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: (getting an idea) You know, maybe I should’ve auto-rotated and performed a high-bank through our descent. We might’ve crashed a little softer. (pause) Probably wouldn‘t’ve made any difference, though. Ned closes his eyes, and his body goes limp. Zissou puts finger to Ned’s neck to check for a pulse. He looks aroun a panic.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BEACH. DAY
dialogues.text: Zissou carries Ned out of the surf and sets him down in t sand. Smoke rises from the crash site beyond the breaking waves. Zissou sits on his knees next to the body. He take Ned’s hand and holds it.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OCEAN. DAY
dialogues.text: Dusk. The Belafonte sits at anchor with two sea-planes do alongside it. White Christmas lights are strung along the ship’s railings and around the edges of its windows.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MAIN DECK. DAY
dialogues.text: Zissou and his crew stand with Jane, Drakoulias, Phillip, Hennessey, Bill, the Japanese television crew, and two mi aged men in Air Kentucky pilot uniforms around a casket wrapped in a Team Zissou flag. Zissou has cuts, bruises, bandages all over his face and body. Klaus reads from a bundle of little scraps of paper. Ever listens with tears all over their faces -- except Zissou, stares straight ahead with a hollow look in his eyes. Klaus finishes. Jane steps forward with a stack of letter her hand. She tucks them into the casket. She presses the  140. shut and takes a slow, deep breath. She closes her fist around the glittering sand-dollar hanging from her neck.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou, Klaus, Ogata, Pelé, and the two Air Kentucky pilo sliding the casket off the side of the deck. It drops len wise into the surf.

dialogues.speaker: INT. OBSERVATION BUBBLE. DAY
dialogues.text: Eleanor watches sadly through the portholes underwater as casket sinks past her. She smokes a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SALON. NIGHT
dialogues.text: A small reception after the funeral. Pelé is in the corne playing a quiet David Bowie song on his guitar. Eleanor s in a red vinyl armchair next to Drakoulias. She has a box Kleenex in her lap. She touches one to her eyes and tilts head back to keep the tears from running down her face. Zissou, Klaus, and Ogata stand together drinking glasses whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: This is the first time Eleanor’s ever cried in front of me as long as I've known her -- except once when she got her arm caught in the deck-winch. Broke it in two places. Hennessey fills two cups of coffee at an espresso machine the counter. A label on the base of the machine says Operation Hennessey. Hennessey turns abruptly to Bill.

dialogues.speaker: HENNESSEY
dialogues.text: Is this my espresso machine? How’d you get my espresso machine?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: (pause) Ah, we fucking stole it, man. Hennessey frowns. He brings a cup of coffee over to Elean Zissou sits down next to them and says to Hennessey:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Allie, why don’t you go powder your nose? I want to talk to your ex-wife. Hennessey nods. He holds Zissou by the arm and says confidentially:  141.

dialogues.speaker: HENNESSEY
dialogues.text: We’ve never made great husbands, have we? Of course, I have a good excuse. I’m part- gay. Zissou shrugs. He smiles and says warmly:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Supposedly, everyone is. Hennessey hugs Zissou and walks away. Zissou turns to Eleanor. ZISsoU I never told you this, but I was hoping we were going to get the chance to adopt Ned. I think he would’ve wanted it that way. Would you have gone along with me on that one?

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: He was thirty, Steve -- but I would’ve considered it.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (moved) Thanks, Eleanor. Zissou goes over to Drakoulias. They stand together in fr of the window. The moon is up, but it is still light outs

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: We're a dying breed.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess we were all right while we lasted, though, weren’t we?

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: Oh, we were like glory’s gate, my darling. We were like that bloody shark of yours. We swam with the -~ goddammit, I had it on the plane. What was I going to say? Oh, well. It’s good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: How's your passport status?

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: Much better, thank you. I’m back down to X-4.  142. Drakoulias motions to Jane sitting alone on a red vinyl s across the room. She looks devastated. Mascara runs down cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: DRAKOULIAS
dialogues.text: Who knocked-up the reporter?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (pause) I don’t know. Zissou picks up a chocolate-covered strawberry and a napk off a tray. He walks over to Jane and sits down beside he He hands her the strawberry. She takes a bite.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: By the way, thanks for showing me your first draft.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: You read it? What’d you think?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Well, at first I was embarrassed. Obviously, people are going to think I’m a showboat and a little bit of a prick -- but then I realized: that’s me. I said those things. I did those things. (shrugs) I can live with that. Jane smiles desolately. She takes the napkin and rubs off some of her smeared mascara. Zissou says simply:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: You’re a good writer, Jane.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: It’s the f-ing cover.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (wistfully) That a girl. Wolodarsky opens the door and says:

dialogues.speaker: WOLODARSKY
dialogues.text: Excuse me. I’m sorry to interrupt, but we just got the scanning monitor back up, and the jaguar shark or whatever it is we're tracking looks like it’s ina trench on the far side of the reef.  143. Silence. Zissou looks to the rest of the party and shrugs says sadly:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Anybody feel like going for a ride?

dialogues.speaker: INT. MINIATURE SUBMARINE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Zissou, Eleanor, Jane, Klaus, Drakoulias, Bill, Wolodarsk Ogata, Pelé, Vikram, Renzo, Hennessey, and the remaining intern with the broken arm are all squeezed into Zissou’s submersible Deep Search, formerly Jacqueline. Flowing wat casts shadows in patterns on their faces. Zissou is at th wheel. A depth-sounding ping echoes periodically. There is a large, dead tuna with clusters of sparkling ch among its scales trailing at the end of a line behind the Zissou points it out to Jane:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I hooked a rhinestone bluefin on a rope to give him something to eat. Jane nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dashboard control panel. A warning sticker below the gauge reads: No more than six (6) passengers permitted at time. Zissou presses a button and a piece of dreamy electronic music begins to play.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou steering the vessel into a pitch-black trench. He flips a switch and turns on the lights outside the submar They descend through schools of luminous fish, past giant crabs, sea-turtles, electric eels, and octopuses which da cut from their caves to see them. Tiny, glowing, transluc creatures circle around them as they dive deeper and deep They arrive at the bottom of the trench. Black water smok from stacks among the rocks below, and strange flowers an vines float and shiver on the ocean’s floor. An undersea river with a mist over it winds through a shallow canyon. submarine hovers. Zissou compares the numbers on the instrument panel with list in a notebook. Wolodarsky types something into a calculator and turns to Zissou. He shrugs. Zissou neds. H dims the lights. They look out into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A school of gently glowing pink fish suddenly swarms arou the vessel, swirling in all directions, and disappears. Zissou breathes heavily. Everyone waits in silence. A gigantic shark seventy feet long emerges slowly from th darkness. It looks scratched and scarred and pre-historic Its skin is covered with black and gold rings and circles and it shimmers with a silver lustre. A small homing devi on the end of a dart blinks brightly on it’s back. It swi quietly toward them. Zissou swallows. Everyone watches, hypnetized. Vikram films it. Klaus says oddly:

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Is that him? Hennessey answers quietly, with emotion:

dialogues.speaker: HENNESSEY
dialogues.text: That’s him, Klaus. The shark sweeps gently past the tiny submarine and bumps lightly, snapping away the tuna. The submarine dips viole and tips over. The passengers are thrown sideways. They l at each other, terrified. Zissou rights the submarine and steers away from the rocks. Jane whispers:

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Are we safe in here? Zissou turns to Jane and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I doubt it. The shark circles back around them. Klaus looks concerned

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Do we still want to blow it up?

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: (pause) Nah. We’re out of dynamite, anyway. Eleanor looks to Zissou. She smiles. She says warmly (in spite of everything):

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: It is beautiful, Steve.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s pretty good, isn’t it? Eleanor nods. Silence. Zissou says softly:  145.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: I wonder if he remembers me. Pause. Tears suddenly stream down Zissou's cheeks. His bo clenches up, and his arms coil around his shoulders. He covers his face and starts crying. Eleanor puts her hand the top of Zissou’s head. Jane puts her hand on Zissou’s knee. Klaus holds Zissou’s shoulder. Drakoulias takes Zissou’s hand. Ogata takes the other. Pelé, Bill, and the broken-armed intern touch Zissou’s back. Hennessey places hand on the back of Zissou’s neck. Zissou reaches out to Jane and puts his hand on her stoma Jane smiles sadly.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: In twelve years, he’ll be eleven and a halt. Zissou looks surprised and touched. He says with his voic cracking:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: That was my favorite age.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Zissou, Ned, and Jane on the deck of the Belafonte, leani against the railing, looking out at the sunset. Ned point the horizon, imitating Zissou’s pose from the official publicity still. He says to Zissou:

dialogues.speaker: NED
dialogues.text: Like this? Zissou nods. He answers wistfully:

dialogues.speaker: Z1ISSOU
dialogues.text: Just like that. Ned takes Jane’s hand. Jane turns to Zissou.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: You do it, too. Zissou smiles. He points to the horizon. The image freeze and he says in voice-over:  146.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We complete the adventure, but another member of our crew has been lost.

dialogues.text: This one was my son.

dialogues.speaker: IN MEMORY
dialogues.text: Ned Kingsley Plimpton Zissou CuT TO: The audience at the screening watching intently. There is empty seat in-between Eleanor and Drakoulias.

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We start the voyage home in our wounded vessel. Jane sits in the front row of the highest tier of the balconies chewing gum and watching the screen. She wears sad, remote look on her face. She holds her baby wrapped blanket with a miniature knitted red cap on its head.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THEATRE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Zissou sits alone on the steps outside the auditorium. A carpet runs down to the street in front of him. There are few guards with machine-guns at the entrance to the theat and a quiet crowd waits behind a barricade.  147. Zissou wears his red pin in the lapel of his tuxedo and h gold legion of honor medal around his neck. There is a go plated award statuette of a barracuda on the pavement bes him. He smokes a joint. The sound of applause is heard from inside. Klaus’ nephew, Werner, comes out and sits next to Zissou. Zissou looks at him. Pause. Zissou reaches into his pocke and takes out Ned’s Team Zissou ring. He gives it to Wern Werner examines it and puts it onto his finger. Zissou makes a little flick of the wrist and says quietly

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: Ho. Werner looks up at Zissou. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: WERNER
dialogues.text: Ho. Strings of lights flicker over Zissou and Werner’s heads. Zissou says wearily with hope and regret:

dialogues.speaker: ZISSOU
dialogues.text: This is an adventure. Three sets of double-doors open at once and the audience bursts out from the lobby. The waiting crowd pushes throu the barricade. Fans and paparazzi surround Zissou and Wer Zissou grabs his award statuette. He picks up Werner with hand and sets him onto his shoulders. He walks sadly down red carpet with Werner floating above the rushing mob. Flashbulbs go off all around them. They disappear into th congregation as it flows down the street to the marina. The Belafonte waits moored in the bay.
